DISTANCE_MATRIX.description: Calculate a matrix of distances between atoms.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

MASK.description: a vector that is used to used to determine which rows of the adjancency matrix to compute

GROUP.description: the atoms for which you would like to calculate the adjacency matrix

GROUPA.description: when you are calculating the adjacency matrix between two sets of atoms this keyword is used to specify the atoms along with the keyword GROUPB

GROUPB.description: when you are calculating the adjacency matrix between two sets of atoms this keyword is used to specify the atoms along with the keyword GROUPA

ATOMS.description: the atoms for which you would like to calculate the adjacency matrix

COMPONENTS.description: also calculate the components of the vector connecting the atoms in the contact matrix

NOPBC.description: don't use pbc

NL_CUTOFF.description: The cutoff for the neighbor list

NL_STRIDE.description: The frequency with which we are updating the atoms in the neighbor list

CUTOFF.description: ignore distances that have a value larger than this cutoff

USEGPU.description: run this calculation on the GPU

w.description: a matrix containing the weights for the bonds between each pair of atoms

x.description: the projection of the bond on the x axis

y.description: the projection of the bond on the y axis

z.description: the projection of the bond on the z axis

value.description: a matrix containing the weights for the bonds between each pair of atoms

DISTANCE_MATRIX.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  GROUP - the atoms for which you would like to calculate the 
                          adjacency matrix. For more information on how to specify lists of 
                          atoms see ef Group 
                 GROUPA - when you are calculating the adjacency matrix between two 
                          sets of atoms this keyword is used to specify the atoms along 
                          with the keyword GROUPB. For more information on how to specify 
                          lists of atoms see ef Group 
                 GROUPB - when you are calculating the adjacency matrix between two 
                          sets of atoms this keyword is used to specify the atoms along 
                          with the keyword GROUPA. For more information on how to specify 
                          lists of atoms see ef Group 
                  ATOMS - the atoms for which you would like to calculate the 
                          adjacency matrix. This is a depracated syntax that is equivalent to 
                          GROUP. You are strongly recommened to use GROUP instead of ATOMS. 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              NL_CUTOFF - ( default=0.0 ) The cutoff for the neighbor list. A value 
                          of 0 means we are not using a neighbor list 
              NL_STRIDE - ( default=1 ) The frequency with which we are updating the 
                          atoms in the neighbor list 
                 CUTOFF - ( default=-1 ) ignore distances that have a value larger 
                          than this cutoff 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
             COMPONENTS - ( default=off ) also calculate the components of the vector 
                          connecting the atoms in the contact matrix 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) don't use pbc 
                 USEGPU - ( default=off ) run this calculation on the GPU 
                   MASK - a vector that is used to used to determine which rows of 
                          the adjancency matrix to compute

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

ATOMS.description: the pair of atom that we are calculating the distance between

COMPONENTS.description: calculate the x, y and z components of the distance separately and store them as label

SCALED_COMPONENTS.description: calculate the a, b and c scaled components of the distance separately and store them as label

NO_ACTION_LOG.description: suppresses printing from action on the log

x.description: the x-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

y.description: the y-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

z.description: the z-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

a.description: the normalized projection on the first lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

b.description: the normalized projection on the second lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

c.description: the normalized projection on the third lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

value.description: the DISTANCE between this pair of atoms

DISTANCE_SCALAR.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the pair of atom that we are calculating the distance 
                          between. For more information on how to specify lists of atoms see 
                          ef Group 

The following options are available

                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
             COMPONENTS - ( default=off ) calculate the x, y and z components of the 
                          distance separately and store them as label.x, label.y and label.z 
      SCALED_COMPONENTS - ( default=off ) calculate the a, b and c scaled components 
                          of the distance separately and store them as label.a, label.b 
                          and label.c

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

ATOMS.description: the pair of atom that we are calculating the distance between

COMPONENTS.description: calculate the x, y and z components of the distance separately and store them as label

SCALED_COMPONENTS.description: calculate the a, b and c scaled components of the distance separately and store them as label

NO_ACTION_LOG.description: suppresses printing from action on the log

USEGPU.description: run this calculation on the GPU

MASK.description: the label for a sparse vector that should be used to determine which elements of the vector should be computed

x.description: the x-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

y.description: the y-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

z.description: the z-component of the vector connecting the two atoms

a.description: the normalized projection on the first lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

b.description: the normalized projection on the second lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

c.description: the normalized projection on the third lattice vector of the vector connecting the two atoms

value.description: the DISTANCE for each set of specified atoms

DISTANCE_VECTOR.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the pair of atom that we are calculating the distance 
                          between. For more information on how to specify lists of atoms see 
                          ef Group 

The following options are available

                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
             COMPONENTS - ( default=off ) calculate the x, y and z components of the 
                          distance separately and store them as label.x, label.y and label.z 
      SCALED_COMPONENTS - ( default=off ) calculate the a, b and c scaled components 
                          of the distance separately and store them as label.a, label.b 
                          and label.c 
                 USEGPU - ( default=off ) run this calculation on the GPU 
                   MASK - the label for a sparse vector that should be used to 
                          determine which elements of the vector should be computed

DOMAIN_DECOMPOSITION.description: Pass domain decomposed properties of atoms to PLUMED

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NO_ACTION_LOG.description: suppresses printing from action on the log

NATOMS.description: the number of atoms across all the domains

VALUE.description: value to create for the domain decomposition

UNIT.description: unit of the ith value that is being passed through the domain decomposition

CONSTANT.description: is the ith value that is being passed through the domain decomposition constant

PERIODIC.description: if the value being passed to plumed is periodic then you should specify the periodicity of the function

ROLE.description: Get the role this value plays in the code can be x/y/z/m/q to signify that this is x, y, z positions of atoms or masses or charges of atoms

PBCLABEL.description: the label to use for the PBC action that will be created

value.description: the domain that each atom is within

DOMAIN_DECOMPOSITION.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 NATOMS - the number of atoms across all the domains 
               PBCLABEL - ( default=Box ) the label to use for the PBC action that 
                          will be created 
                  VALUE - value to create for the domain decomposition. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. VALUE1, VALUE2, VALUE3... 
                   UNIT - unit of the ith value that is being passed through the 
                          domain decomposition. You can use multiple instances of this 
                          keyword i.e. UNIT1, UNIT2, UNIT3... 
               CONSTANT - is the ith value that is being passed through the domain 
                          decomposition constant. You can use multiple instances of this keyword 
                          i.e. CONSTANT1, CONSTANT2, CONSTANT3... 
               PERIODIC - if the value being passed to plumed is periodic then you 
                          should specify the periodicity of the function. If the value is 
                          not periodic you must state this using PERIODIC=NO. Positions 
                          are passed with PERIODIC=NO even though special methods are 
                          used to deal with pbc. You can use multiple instances of this 
                          keyword i.e. PERIODIC1, PERIODIC2, PERIODIC3... 
                   ROLE - Get the role this value plays in the code can be x/y/z/m/q 
                          to signify that this is x, y, z positions of atoms or masses 
                          or charges of atoms. You can use multiple instances of this 
                          keyword i.e. ROLE1, ROLE2, ROLE3...

DOPS.description: Calculate DOPS order parameter for molecules.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

SPECIES.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as coordination number

SPECIESA.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination number

SPECIESB.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination number

KERNELFILE.description: the file containing the list of kernel parameters

CUTOFF.description: to make the calculation faster we calculate a cutoff value on the distances

value.description: the values of the DOPS order parameters

DOPS.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - this keyword is used for colvars such as coordination 
                          number. In that context it specifies that plumed should calculate 
                          one coordination number for each of the atoms specified. Each 
                          of these coordination numbers specifies how many of the other 
                          specified atoms are within a certain cutoff of the central atom. You 
                          can specify the atoms here as another multicolvar action or 
                          using a MultiColvarFilter or ActionVolume action. When you do so 
                          the quantity is calculated for those atoms specified in the 
                          previous multicolvar. This is useful if you would like to calculate 
                          the Steinhardt parameter for those atoms that have a 
                          coordination number more than four for example. For more information on 
                          how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
               SPECIESA - this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination 
                          number. In that context it species that plumed should calculate one 
                          coordination number for each of the atoms specified in SPECIESA. Each of 
                          these cooordination numbers specifies how many of the atoms 
                          specifies using SPECIESB is within the specified cutoff. As with the 
                          species keyword the input can also be specified using the label of 
                          another multicolvar 
               SPECIESB - this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination 
                          number. It must appear with SPECIESA. For a full explanation see 
                          the documentation for that keyword 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

             KERNELFILE - the file containing the list of kernel parameters. We 
                          expect h, mu and sigma parameters for a 1D Gaussian kernel of the 
                          form h*exp(-(x-mu)^2/2sigma^2) 
                 CUTOFF - ( default=6.25 ) to make the calculation faster we 
                          calculate a cutoff value on the distances. The input to this keyword 
                          determines x in this expreession max(mu + sqrt(2*x)/sigma)

DRMSD.description: Calculate the distance RMSD with respect to a reference structure.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

REFERENCE.description: a file in pdb format containing the reference structure and the atoms involved in the CV

LOWER_CUTOFF.description: only pairs of atoms further than LOWER_CUTOFF are considered in the calculation

UPPER_CUTOFF.description: only pairs of atoms closer than UPPER_CUTOFF are considered in the calculation

TYPE.description: what kind of DRMSD would you like to calculate

SQUARED.description: This should be setted if you want MSD instead of RMSD

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: Including this keyword in the input to this action makes no difference to the calculation performed it was used in older versions of PLUMED and is provided here for back compatibility only

value.description: the DRMSD distance between the instantaneous structure and the reference structure

DRMSD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

              REFERENCE - a file in pdb format containing the reference structure and 
                          the atoms involved in the CV. 
                   TYPE - ( default=DRMSD ) what kind of DRMSD would you like to 
                          calculate. You can use either the normal DRMSD involving all the 
                          distances between the atoms in your molecule. Alternatively, if you 
                          have multiple molecules you can use the type INTER-DRMSD to 
                          compute DRMSD values involving only those distances between the 
                          atoms at least two molecules or the type INTRA-DRMSD to compute 
                          DRMSD values involving only those distances between atoms in the 
                          same molecule 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                SQUARED - ( default=off ) This should be setted if you want MSD 
                          instead of RMSD 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
           LOWER_CUTOFF - only pairs of atoms further than LOWER_CUTOFF are 
                          considered in the calculation. 
           UPPER_CUTOFF - only pairs of atoms closer than UPPER_CUTOFF are considered 
                          in the calculation.

DRR.description: Used to performed extended-system adaptive biasing force (eABF)

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

KAPPA.description: specifies that the restraint is harmonic and what the values of the force constants on each of the variables are (default to k_BT/(GRID_SPACING)^2)

TAU.description: specifies relaxation time on each of variables are, similar to extended Time Constant in Colvars

FRICTION.description: add a friction to the variable, similar to extended Langevin Damping in Colvars

GRID_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the grid (GRID_BIN or GRID_SPACING should be specified)

GRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid (GRID_BIN or GRID_SPACING should be specified)

REFLECTINGWALL.description: whether add reflecting walls for each CV at GRID_MIN and GRID_MAX

GRID_BIN.description: the number of bins for the grid

GRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with GRID_BIN)

ZGRID_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the grid (ZGRID_BIN or ZGRID_SPACING should be specified)

ZGRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid (ZGRID_BIN or ZGRID_SPACING should be specified)

ZGRID_BIN.description: the number of bins for the grid

ZGRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with ZGRID_BIN)

EXTERNAL_FORCE.description: use forces from other action instead of internal spring force, this disable the extended system!

EXTERNAL_FICT.description: position of external fictitious particles, useful for UIESTIMATOR

FULLSAMPLES.description: number of samples in a bin prior to application of the ABF

MAXFACTOR.description: maximum scaling factor of biasing force

OUTPUTFREQ.description: write results to a file every N steps

HISTORYFREQ.description: save history to a file every N steps

UIRESTARTPREFIX.description: specify the restart files for umbrella integration

OUTPUTPREFIX.description: specify the output prefix (default to the label name)

TEMP.description: the system temperature - needed when FRICTION is present

EXTTEMP.description: the temperature of extended variables (default to system temperature)

TEXTOUTPUT.description: use text output for grad and count files instead of boost::serialization binary output

MERGEHISTORYFILES.description: output all historic results to a single file rather than multiple

FMT.description: specify format for outfiles files (useful for decrease the number of digits in regtests)

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

_fict.description: one or multiple instances of this quantity can be referenced elsewhere in the input file

_vfict.description: one or multiple instances of this quantity can be referenced elsewhere in the input file

_biasforce.description: The bias force from eABF/DRR of the fictitious particle

_springforce.description: Spring force between real CVs and extended CVs

_fictNoPBC.description: the positions of fictitious particles (without PBC)

DRR.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                    TAU - ( default=0.5 ) specifies relaxation time on each of 
                          variables are, similar to extended Time Constant in Colvars 
               FRICTION - ( default=8.0 ) add a friction to the variable, similar to 
                          extended Langevin Damping in Colvars 
               GRID_MIN - the lower bounds for the grid (GRID_BIN or GRID_SPACING 
                          should be specified) 
               GRID_MAX - the upper bounds for the grid (GRID_BIN or GRID_SPACING 
                          should be specified) 
         REFLECTINGWALL - ( default=0 ) whether add reflecting walls for each CV at 
                          GRID_MIN and GRID_MAX. Setting non-zero values will enable this 
                          feature 
            FULLSAMPLES - ( default=500 ) number of samples in a bin prior to 
                          application of the ABF 
              MAXFACTOR - ( default=1.0 ) maximum scaling factor of biasing force 
             OUTPUTFREQ - write results to a file every N steps 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                 NOCZAR - ( default=off ) disable the CZAR estimator 
                     UI - ( default=off ) enable the umbrella integration estimator 
                 NOBIAS - ( default=off ) DO NOT apply bias forces. 
             TEXTOUTPUT - ( default=off ) use text output for grad and count files 
                          instead of boost::serialization binary output 
      MERGEHISTORYFILES - ( default=off ) output all historic results to a single 
                          file rather than multiple .drrstate files. This option is 
                          effective only when textOutput is on. 
                  KAPPA - specifies that the restraint is harmonic and what the 
                          values of the force constants on each of the variables are 
                          (default to k_BT/(GRID_SPACING)^2) 
               GRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
           GRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with GRID_BIN) 
              ZGRID_MIN - the lower bounds for the grid (ZGRID_BIN or ZGRID_SPACING 
                          should be specified) 
              ZGRID_MAX - the upper bounds for the grid (ZGRID_BIN or ZGRID_SPACING 
                          should be specified) 
              ZGRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
          ZGRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with ZGRID_BIN) 
         EXTERNAL_FORCE - use forces from other action instead of internal spring 
                          force, this disable the extended system! 
          EXTERNAL_FICT - position of external fictitious particles, useful for 
                          UIESTIMATOR 
            HISTORYFREQ - save history to a file every N steps 
        UIRESTARTPREFIX - specify the restart files for umbrella integration 
           OUTPUTPREFIX - specify the output prefix (default to the label name) 
                   TEMP - the system temperature - needed when FRICTION is present. 
                          If not provided will be taken from MD code (if available) 
                EXTTEMP - the temperature of extended variables (default to system 
                          temperature) 
              DRR_RFILE - specifies the restart file (.drrstate file) 
                    FMT - specify format for outfiles files (useful for decrease the 
                          number of digits in regtests)

DUMPATOMS.description: Dump selected atoms on a file.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the labels of vectors that should be output in the xyz file

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the atoms should be output

ATOMS.description: the atom indices whose positions you would like to print out

FILE.description: file on which to output coordinates; extension is automatically detected

UNITS.description: the units in which to print out the coordinates

PRECISION.description: The number of digits in trajectory file

TYPE.description: file type, either xyz, gro, xtc, or trr, can override an automatically detected file extension

LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.description: when printing with arguments that are vectors only print components of vectors have a value less than or equal to this value

GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL.description: when printing with arguments that are vectors only print components of vectors have a value greater than or equal to this value

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

DUMPATOMS.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the atom indices whose positions you would like to print 
                          out. For more information on how to specify lists of atoms see 
                          ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which the atoms should be 
                          output 
                   FILE - file on which to output coordinates; extension is 
                          automatically detected 
                  UNITS - ( default=PLUMED ) the units in which to print out the 
                          coordinates. PLUMED means internal PLUMED units 
                    ARG - the labels of vectors that should be output in the xyz 
                          file. The number of elements in the vector should equal the 
                          number of atoms output 
              PRECISION - The number of digits in trajectory file 
                   TYPE - file type, either xyz, gro, xtc, or trr, can override an 
                          automatically detected file extension 
     LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL - when printing with arguments that are vectors only print 
                          components of vectors have a value less than or equal to this value 
  GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL - when printing with arguments that are vectors only print 
                          components of vectors have a value greater than or equal to this value 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the labels of the FIND_CONTOUR action that you would like to output

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the grid should be output to the file

FILE.description: the file on which to write the grid

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

DUMPCONTOUR.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the FIND_CONTOUR action that you would like 
                          to output 
                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which the grid should be 
                          output to the file. 
                   FILE - ( default=density ) the file on which to write the grid. 
                    FMT - ( default=%f ) the format that should be used to output 
                          real numbers

DUMPCUBE.description: Output a three dimensional grid using the Gaussian cube file format.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the label for the grid that you would like to output

GRID.description: the grid you would like to print (can also use ARG for specifying what is being printed)

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the grid should be output to the file

FILE.description: the file on which to write the grid

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

PRINT_XYZ.description: output coordinates on fibonacci grid to xyz file

PRINT_ONE_FILE.description: output grids one after the other in a single file

DUMPCUBE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label for the grid that you would like to output 
                 STRIDE - ( default=0 ) the frequency with which the grid should be 
                          output to the file. Default of zero means dump at end of 
                          calculation 
                   FILE - ( default=density ) the file on which to write the grid. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

              PRINT_XYZ - ( default=off ) output coordinates on fibonacci grid to xyz 
                          file 
         PRINT_ONE_FILE - ( default=off ) output grids one after the other in a 
                          single file 
                   GRID - the grid you would like to print (can also use ARG for 
                          specifying what is being printed) 
                    FMT - the format that should be used to output real numbers

DUMPDERIVATIVES.description: Dump the derivatives with respect to the input parameters for scalar values (generally CVs, functions or biases).

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the labels of the values whose derivatives should be output

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the derivatives should be output

FILE.description: the name of the file on which to output the derivatives

FMT.description: the format with which the derivatives should be output

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

DUMPDERIVATIVES.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the values whose derivatives should be output 
                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which the derivatives 
                          should be output 
                   FILE - the name of the file on which to output the derivatives 
                    FMT - ( default=%15.10f ) the format with which the derivatives 
                          should be output 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

DUMPFORCES.description: Dump the force acting on one of a values in a file.

ARG.description: the labels of the values whose forces should be output

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces should be output

FILE.description: the name of the file on which to output the forces

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

DUMPFORCES.help:

                   FILE - the name of the file on which to output the forces 
                    FMT - ( default=%15.10f ) the format with which the derivatives

                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

GRID.description: the grid you would like to print (can also use ARG for specifying what is being printed)

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the grid should be output to the file

FILE.description: the file on which to write the grid

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

PRINT_XYZ.description: output coordinates on fibonacci grid to xyz file

DUMPGRID.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label for the grid that you would like to output 
                 STRIDE - ( default=0 ) the frequency with which the grid should be 
                          output to the file. Default of zero means dump at end of 
                          calculation 
                   FILE - ( default=density ) the file on which to write the grid. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

              PRINT_XYZ - ( default=off ) output coordinates on fibonacci grid to xyz

         PRINT_ONE_FILE - ( default=off ) output grids one after the other in a

                   GRID - the grid you would like to print (can also use ARG for

                    FMT - the format that should be used to output real numbers

DUMPMASSCHARGE.description: Dump masses and charges on a selected file.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the atoms should be output

ATOMS.description: the atom indices whose charges and masses you would like to print out

FILE.description: file on which to output charges and masses

DUMPMASSCHARGE.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the atom indices whose charges and masses you would like to 
                          print out. For more information on how to specify lists of atoms 
                          see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which the atoms should be 
                          output 
                   FILE - file on which to output charges and masses. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

            ONLY_MASSES - ( default=off ) Only output masses to file 
           ONLY_CHARGES - ( default=off ) Only output charges to file

DUMPMULTICOLVAR.description: Dump atom positions and a vector of values to a file.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

DATA.description: the vector you wish to transform

FILE.description: the file that you would like to output the data to

DUMPMULTICOLVAR.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   DATA - the vector you wish to transform 
                   FILE - the file that you would like to output the data to

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the values that are being output in the PDB file

ATOMS.description: value containing positions of atoms that should be output

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the atoms should be output

FILE.description: the name of the file on which to output these quantities

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

OCCUPANCY.description: vector of values to output in the occupancy column of the pdb file

BETA.description: vector of values to output in the beta column of the pdb file

DESCRIPTION.description: the title to use for your PDB output

ATOM_INDICES.description: the indices of the atoms in your PDB output

RESIDUE_INDICES.description: the indices of the residues in your PDB output

ARG_NAMES.description: the names of the arguments that are being output

DUMPPDB.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 STRIDE - ( default=0 ) the frequency with which the atoms should be 
                          output 
                   FILE - the name of the file on which to output these quantities 
                    FMT - ( default=%f ) the format that should be used to output 
                          real numbers 
              OCCUPANCY - ( default=1.0 ) vector of values to output in the occupancy 
                          column of the pdb file 
                   BETA - ( default=1.0 ) vector of values to output in the beta 
                          column of the pdb file 
                    ARG - the values that are being output in the PDB file 
                  ATOMS - value containing positions of atoms that should be output 
            DESCRIPTION - the title to use for your PDB output 
           ATOM_INDICES - the indices of the atoms in your PDB output 
        RESIDUE_INDICES - the indices of the residues in your PDB output 
              ARG_NAMES - the names of the arguments that are being output

DUMPPROJECTIONS.description: Dump the derivatives with respect to the input parameters for one or more objects (generally CVs, functions or biases).

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the labels of the values whose gradients should be outpu

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the derivatives should be output

FILE.description: the name of the file on which to output the derivatives

FMT.description: the format with which the derivatives should be output

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

DUMPPROJECTIONS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the values whose gradients should be outpu 
                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which the derivatives 
                          should be output 
                   FILE - the name of the file on which to output the derivatives 
                    FMT - ( default=%15.10f ) the format with which the derivatives 
                          should be output 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

DUMPVECTOR.description: Print a vector to a file

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

ARG.description: the labels of vectors/matrices that should be output in the file

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the grid should be output to the file

FILE.description: the file on which to write the vetors

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

PRINT_ONE_FILE.description: output vectors one after the other in a single file

DUMPVECTOR.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of vectors/matrices that should be output in the 
                          file 
                 STRIDE - ( default=0 ) the frequency with which the grid should be 
                          output to the file. 
                   FILE - ( default=density ) the file on which to write the vetors 

In addition you may use the following options: 

         PRINT_ONE_FILE - ( default=off ) output vectors one after the other in a 
                          single file 
                    FMT - the format that should be used to output real numbers

ECV_CUSTOM.description: Use some given CVs as a set of expansion collective variables (ECVs).

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

ARG.description: the labels of the single ECVs

ADD_P0.description: add the unbiased Boltzmann distribution to the target distribution, to make sure to sample it

DIMENSIONLESS.description: consider ARG as dimensionless rather than an energy, thus do not multiply it by beta

BARRIER.description: a guess of the free energy barrier to be overcome (better to stay higher than lower)

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

ECV_CUSTOM.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get 
                          it from MD engine 
                    ARG - the labels of the single ECVs. Delta U_i, in energy units 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                 ADD_P0 - ( default=off ) add the unbiased Boltzmann distribution to 
                          the target distribution, to make sure to sample it 
          DIMENSIONLESS - ( default=off ) consider ARG as dimensionless rather than 
                          an energy, thus do not multiply it by beta 
                BARRIER - a guess of the free energy barrier to be overcome (better 
                          to stay higher than lower)

ECV_LINEAR.description: Linear expansion, according to a parameter lambda.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

ARG.description: the label of the Hamiltonian difference

LAMBDA.description: the lambda at which the underlying simulation runs

LAMBDA_MIN.description: the minimum of the lambda range

LAMBDA_MAX.description: the maximum of the lambda range

LAMBDA_STEPS.description: uniformly place the lambda values, for a total of LAMBDA_STEPS

DIMENSIONLESS.description: ARG is considered dimensionless rather than an energy, thus is not multiplied by beta

GEOM_SPACING.description: use geometrical spacing in lambda instead of linear spacing

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

ECV_LINEAR.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get 
                          it from MD engine 
                    ARG - the label of the Hamiltonian difference. Delta U 
                 LAMBDA - ( default=0 ) the lambda at which the underlying simulation 
                          runs 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
          DIMENSIONLESS - ( default=off ) ARG is considered dimensionless rather than 
                          an energy, thus is not multiplied by beta 
           GEOM_SPACING - ( default=off ) use geometrical spacing in lambda instead 
                          of linear spacing 
             LAMBDA_MIN - ( default=0 ) the minimum of the lambda range 
             LAMBDA_MAX - ( default=1 ) the maximum of the lambda range 
           LAMBDA_STEPS - uniformly place the lambda values, for a total of 
                          LAMBDA_STEPS 
         LAMBDA_SET_ALL - manually set all the lamdbas

ECV_MULTITHERMAL.description: Expand a simulation to sample multiple temperatures simultaneously.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

ARG.description: the label of the internal energy of the system

TEMP_MIN.description: the minimum of the temperature range

TEMP_MAX.description: the maximum of the temperature range

TEMP_STEPS.description: the number of steps in temperature

NO_GEOM_SPACING.description: do not use geometrical spacing in temperature, but instead linear spacing in inverse temperature

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

ECV_MULTITHERMAL.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get 
                          it from MD engine 
                    ARG - the label of the internal energy of the system. If volume 
                          is fixed it is calculated by the ENERGY colvar 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
        NO_GEOM_SPACING - ( default=off ) do not use geometrical spacing in 
                          temperature, but instead linear spacing in inverse temperature 
               TEMP_MIN - the minimum of the temperature range 
               TEMP_MAX - the maximum of the temperature range 
             TEMP_STEPS - the number of steps in temperature 
           TEMP_SET_ALL - manually set all the temperatures

ECV_MULTITHERMAL_MULTIBARIC.description: Expand a simulation to sample multiple temperatures and pressures.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

ARG.description: the labels of the potential energy and of the volume of the system

TEMP_MIN.description: the minimum of the temperature range

TEMP_MAX.description: the maximum of the temperature range

TEMP_STEPS.description: the number of steps in temperature

NO_GEOM_SPACING.description: do not use geometrical spacing in temperature, but instead linear spacing in inverse temperature

PRESSURE_MIN.description: the minimum of the pressure range

PRESSURE_MAX.description: the maximum of the pressure range

PRESSURE_STEPS.description: the number of steps in pressure

SET_ALL_TEMP_PRESSURE.description: manually set all the target temperature_pressure pairs

CUT_CORNER.description: avoid region of high temperature and low pressure

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

ECV_MULTITHERMAL_MULTIBARIC.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get 
                          it from MD engine 
                    ARG - the labels of the potential energy and of the volume of the 
                          system. You can calculate them with ENERGY and VOLUME respectively 
               PRESSURE - pressure. Use the proper units 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
        NO_GEOM_SPACING - ( default=off ) do not use geometrical spacing in 
                          temperature, but instead linear spacing in inverse temperature 
               TEMP_MIN - the minimum of the temperature range 
               TEMP_MAX - the maximum of the temperature range 
             TEMP_STEPS - the number of steps in temperature 
           TEMP_SET_ALL - manually set all the temperatures 
           PRESSURE_MIN - the minimum of the pressure range 
           PRESSURE_MAX - the maximum of the pressure range 
         PRESSURE_STEPS - the number of steps in pressure 
       PRESSURE_SET_ALL - manually set all the pressures 
  SET_ALL_TEMP_PRESSURE - manually set all the target temperature_pressure pairs. An 
                          underscore separates temperature and pressure, while different points 
                          are comma-separated, e.g.: temp1_pres1,temp1_pres2,... 
             CUT_CORNER - avoid region of high temperature and low pressure.

ECV_UMBRELLAS_FILE.description: Target a multiumbrella ensemble, by combining systems each with a parabolic bias potential at a different location.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

ARG.description: the labels of the scalar values that are input to this action

FILE.description: the name of the file containing the umbrellas

BARRIER.description: a guess of the free energy barrier to be overcome (better to stay higher than lower)

ADD_P0.description: add the unbiased Boltzmann distribution to the target distribution, to make sure to sample it

LOWER_HALF_ONLY.description: use only the lower half of each umbrella potentials

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

ECV_UMBRELLAS_FILE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get 
                          it from MD engine 
                    ARG - the labels of the scalar values that are input to this 
                          action 
                   FILE - the name of the file containing the umbrellas 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                 ADD_P0 - ( default=off ) add the unbiased Boltzmann distribution to 
                          the target distribution, to make sure to sample it 
        LOWER_HALF_ONLY - ( default=off ) use only the lower half of each umbrella 
                          potentials 
                BARRIER - a guess of the free energy barrier to be overcome (better 
                          to stay higher than lower)

ECV_UMBRELLAS_LINE.description: Target a multiumbrella ensemble, by combining systems each with a parabolic bias potential at a different location.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

TEMP.description: temperature

SIGMA.description: sigma of the umbrella Gaussians

SPACING.description: the distance between umbrellas, in units of SIGMA

ECV_UMBRELLAS_LINE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not specified tries to get

                    ARG - the labels of the scalar values that are input to this 
                          action 
                 CV_MIN - the minimum of the CV range to be explored 
                 CV_MAX - the maximum of the CV range to be explored 
                  SIGMA - sigma of the umbrella Gaussians 
                SPACING - ( default=1 ) the distance between umbrellas, in units of

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these

        LOWER_HALF_ONLY - ( default=off ) use only the lower half of each umbrella

EDS.description: Add a linear bias on a set of observables.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

CENTER.description: The desired centers (equilibrium values) which will be sought during the adaptive linear biasing

CENTER_ARG.description: The desired centers (equilibrium values) which will be sought during the adaptive linear biasing

PERIOD.description: Steps over which to adjust bias for adaptive or ramping

RANGE.description: The (starting) maximum increase in coupling constant per PERIOD (in k_B T/[BIAS_SCALE unit]) for each CV biased

SEED.description: Seed for random order of changing bias

FIXED.description: Fixed target values for coupling constant

BIAS_SCALE.description: A divisor to set the units of the bias

TEMP.description: The system temperature

MULTI_PROP.description: What proportion of dimensions to update at each step

VIRIAL.description: Add an update penalty for having non-zero virial contributions

LOGWEIGHTS.description: Add weights to use for computing statistics

LM.description: Use Levenberg-Marquadt algorithm along with simultaneous keyword

LM_MIXING.description: Initial mixing parameter when using Levenberg-Marquadt minimization

RESTART_FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers in EDS restarts

OUT_RESTART.description: Output file for all information needed to continue EDS simulation

IN_RESTART.description: Read this file to continue an EDS simulation

RAMP.description: Slowly increase bias constant to a fixed value

COVAR.description: Utilize the covariance matrix when updating the bias

FREEZE.description: Fix bias at current level (only used for restarting)

MEAN.description: Instead of using final bias level from restart, use average

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

force2.description: squared value of force from the bias

pressure.description: If using virial keyword, this is the current sum of virial terms

_coupling.description: For each named CV biased, there will be a corresponding output CV_coupling storing the current linear bias prefactor

EDS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                  RANGE - ( default=25.0 ) The (starting) maximum increase in 
                          coupling constant per PERIOD (in k_B T/[BIAS_SCALE unit]) for each 
                          CV biased 
                   SEED - ( default=0 ) Seed for random order of changing bias 
                   INIT - ( default=0 ) Starting value for coupling constant 
                  FIXED - ( default=0 ) Fixed target values for coupling constant. 
                          Non-adaptive. 
              LM_MIXING - ( default=1 ) Initial mixing parameter when using 
                          Levenberg-Marquadt minimization. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                     LM - ( default=off ) Use Levenberg-Marquadt algorithm along with 
                          simultaneous keyword. Otherwise use gradient descent. 
                   RAMP - ( default=off ) Slowly increase bias constant to a fixed 
                          value 
                  COVAR - ( default=off ) Utilize the covariance matrix when updating 
                          the bias. Default Off, but may be enabled due to other options 
                 FREEZE - ( default=off ) Fix bias at current level (only used for 
                          restarting). 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) Instead of using final bias level from 
                          restart, use average. Can only be used in conjunction with FREEZE 
                 CENTER - The desired centers (equilibrium values) which will be 
                          sought during the adaptive linear biasing. This is for fixed 
                          centers 
             CENTER_ARG - The desired centers (equilibrium values) which will be 
                          sought during the adaptive linear biasing. CENTER_ARG is for 
                          calculated centers, e.g. from a CV or analysis. 
                 PERIOD - Steps over which to adjust bias for adaptive or ramping 
             BIAS_SCALE - A divisor to set the units of the bias. If not set, this 
                          will be the CENTER value by default (as is done in White and 
                          Voth 2014). 
                   TEMP - The system temperature. If not provided will be taken from 
                          MD code (if available) 
             MULTI_PROP - What proportion of dimensions to update at each step. Must 
                          be in interval [1,0), where 1 indicates all and any other 
                          indicates a stochastic update. If not set, default is 1 / N, where N 
                          is the number of CVs. 
                 VIRIAL - Add an update penalty for having non-zero virial 
                          contributions. Only makes sense with multiple correlated CVs. 
             LOGWEIGHTS - Add weights to use for computing statistics. For example, 
                          if biasing with metadynamics. 
            RESTART_FMT - the format that should be used to output real numbers in 
                          EDS restarts 
            OUT_RESTART - Output file for all information needed to continue EDS 
                          simulation. If you have the RESTART directive set (global or for EDS), 
                          this file will be appended to. Note that the header will be 
                          printed again if appending. 
             IN_RESTART - Read this file to continue an EDS simulation. If same as 
                          OUT_RESTART and you have not set the RESTART directive, the file will 
                          be backed-up and overwritten with new output. If you do have 
                          the RESTART flag set and it is the same name as OUT_RESTART, 
                          this file will be appended. 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO)

EEFSOLV.description: Calculates EEF1 solvation free energy for a group of atoms.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

ATOMS.description: The atoms to be included in the calculation, e

NL_BUFFER.description: The buffer to the intrinsic cutoff used when calculating pairwise interactions

NL_STRIDE.description: The frequency with which the neighbor list is updated

SERIAL.description: Perform the calculation in serial - for debug purpose

TEMP_CORRECTION.description: Correct free energy of solvation constants for temperatures different from 298

value.description: the EEF1 solvation free energy for the input atoms

EEFSOLV.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - The atoms to be included in the calculation, e.g. the whole 
                          protein.. For more information on how to specify lists of atoms see 
                          ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              NL_BUFFER - ( default=0.1 ) The buffer to the intrinsic cutoff used 
                          when calculating pairwise interactions. 
              NL_STRIDE - ( default=40 ) The frequency with which the neighbor list 
                          is updated. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) Perform the calculation in serial - for 
                          debug purpose 
        TEMP_CORRECTION - ( default=off ) Correct free energy of solvation constants 
                          for temperatures different from 298.15 K

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

STRIDE.description: should be set to 1

FILE.description: file on which to output the effective energy drift

PRINT_STRIDE.description: frequency to which output the effective energy drift on FILE

ENSEMBLE.description: Set to TRUE if you want to average over multiple replicas

FMT.description: the format that should be used to output real numbers

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

EFFECTIVE_ENERGY_DRIFT.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) should be set to 1. Effective energy drift 
                          computation has to be active at each step. 
                   FILE - file on which to output the effective energy drift. 
           PRINT_STRIDE - frequency to which output the effective energy drift on 
                          FILE 

In addition you may use the following options: 

               ENSEMBLE - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to average over 
                          multiple replicas. 
                    FMT - the format that should be used to output real numbers 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

EMMI.description: Calculate the fit of a structure or ensemble of structures with a cryo-EM density map.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the values from which the function is calculated

ATOMS.description: atoms for which we calculate the density map, typically all heavy atoms

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

GMM_FILE.description: file with the parameters of the GMM components

NL_CUTOFF.description: The cutoff in overlap for the neighbor list

NL_STRIDE.description: The frequency with which we are updating the neighbor list

NOISETYPE.description: functional form of the noise (GAUSS, OUTLIERS, MARGINAL)

ERR_FILE.description: file with experimental or GMM fit errors

STATUS_FILE.description: write a file with all the data useful for restart

WRITE_STRIDE.description: write the status to a file every N steps, this can be used for restart

TEMP.description: temperature

WRITE_OV_STRIDE.description: write model overlaps every N steps

WRITE_OV.description: write a file with model overlaps

NO_AVER.description: don't do ensemble averaging in multi-replica mode

REWEIGHT.description: simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy

biasDer.description: derivatives with respect to the bias

sigma.description: uncertainty in the forward models and experiment

EMMI.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - atoms for which we calculate the density map, typically all 
                          heavy atoms. For more information on how to specify lists of 
                          atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

               GMM_FILE - file with the parameters of the GMM components 
              NL_CUTOFF - The cutoff in overlap for the neighbor list 
              NL_STRIDE - The frequency with which we are updating the neighbor list 
              SIGMA_MIN - minimum uncertainty 
             RESOLUTION - Cryo-EM map resolution 
              NOISETYPE - functional form of the noise (GAUSS, OUTLIERS, MARGINAL) 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                NO_AVER - ( default=off ) don't do ensemble averaging in 
                          multi-replica mode 
               REWEIGHT - ( default=off ) simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy 
                    ARG - the labels of the values from which the function is 
                          calculated 
                 SIGMA0 - initial value of the uncertainty 
                 DSIGMA - MC step for uncertainties 
              MC_STRIDE - Monte Carlo stride 
               ERR_FILE - file with experimental or GMM fit errors 
                OV_FILE - file with experimental overlaps 
           NORM_DENSITY - integral of the experimental density 
            STATUS_FILE - write a file with all the data useful for restart 
           WRITE_STRIDE - write the status to a file every N steps, this can be used 
                          for restart 
             REGRESSION - regression stride 
          REG_SCALE_MIN - regression minimum scale 
          REG_SCALE_MAX - regression maximum scale 
             REG_DSCALE - regression maximum scale MC move 
                  SCALE - scale factor 
                 ANNEAL - Length of annealing cycle 
            ANNEAL_FACT - Annealing temperature factor 
                   TEMP - temperature 
                  PRIOR - exponent of uncertainty prior 
        WRITE_OV_STRIDE - write model overlaps every N steps 
               WRITE_OV - write a file with model overlaps 
              AVERAGING - Averaging window for weights

EMMIVOX.description: Bayesian single-structure and ensemble refinement with cryo-EM maps.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

ATOMS.description: atoms used in the calculation of the density map, typically all heavy atoms

NL_STRIDE.description: neighbor list update frequency

STATUS_FILE.description: write a file with all the data useful for restart

TEMP.description: temperature

WRITE_MAP_STRIDE.description: stride for writing model density to file

NO_AVER.description: no ensemble averaging in multi-replica mode

GPU.description: calculate EMMIVOX on GPU with Libtorch

BFACT_NOCHAIN.description: Do not use chain ID for Bfactor MC

BFACT_READ.description: Read Bfactor on RESTART (automatic with DBFACT>0)

BFACT_MINIMIZE.description: Accept only moves that decrease energy

EMMIVOX.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - atoms used in the calculation of the density map, typically 
                          all heavy atoms. For more information on how to specify lists 
                          of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              DATA_FILE - file with cryo-EM map 
             RESOLUTION - cryo-EM map resolution 
           NORM_DENSITY - integral of experimental density 
           WRITE_STRIDE - stride for writing status file 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                NO_AVER - ( default=off ) no ensemble averaging in multi-replica mode 
            CORRELATION - ( default=off ) calculate correlation coefficient 
                    GPU - ( default=off ) calculate EMMIVOX on GPU with Libtorch 
          BFACT_NOCHAIN - ( default=off ) Do not use chain ID for Bfactor MC 
             BFACT_READ - ( default=off ) Read Bfactor on RESTART (automatic with 
                          DBFACT>0) 
         BFACT_MINIMIZE - ( default=off ) Accept only moves that decrease energy 
                MARTINI - ( default=off ) Use Martini scattering factors 
         NL_DIST_CUTOFF - neighbor list distance cutoff 
        NL_GAUSS_CUTOFF - neighbor list Gaussian sigma cutoff 
              NL_STRIDE - neighbor list update frequency 
              SIGMA_MIN - minimum density error 
                 DBFACT - Bfactor MC step 
              BFACT_MAX - Bfactor maximum value 
         MCBFACT_STRIDE - Bfactor MC stride 
            BFACT_SIGMA - Bfactor sigma prior 
            STATUS_FILE - write a file with all the data useful for restart 
                  SCALE - scale factor 
                 OFFSET - offset 
                   TEMP - temperature 
              WRITE_MAP - file with model density 
       WRITE_MAP_STRIDE - stride for writing model density to file

ENVIRONMENTSIMILARITY.description: Measure how similar the environment around atoms is to that found in some reference crystal structure.

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

SPECIES.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as coordination number

SPECIESA.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination number

SPECIESB.description: this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination number

SIGMA.description: the width to use for the gaussian kernels

LCUTOFF.description: any atoms separated by less than this tolerance should be ignored

REFERENCE.description: PDB files with relative distances from central atom

REFERENCE_.description: PDB files with relative distances from central atom

CUTOFF.description: how many multiples of sigma would you like to consider beyond the maximum distance in the environment

ATOM_NAMES_FILE.description: PDB file with atom names for all atoms in SPECIES

LESS_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are less than a certain target value

MORE_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are more than a certain target value

BETWEEN.description: calculate the number of values that are within a certain range

HIGHEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the highest of these variables

HISTOGRAM.description: calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of values

LOWEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the lowest of these variables

SUM.description: calculate the sum of all the quantities

MEAN.description: calculate the mean of all the quantities

value.description: the environmental similar parameter for each of the input atoms

lessthan.description: the number of colvars that have a value less than a threshold

morethan.description: the number of colvars that have a value more than a threshold

altmin.description: the minimum value of the cv

between.description: the number of colvars that have a value that lies in a particular interval

ENVIRONMENTSIMILARITY.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - this keyword is used for colvars such as coordination 
                          number. In that context it specifies that plumed should calculate 
                          one coordination number for each of the atoms specified. Each 
                          of these coordination numbers specifies how many of the other 
                          specified atoms are within a certain cutoff of the central atom. You 
                          can specify the atoms here as another multicolvar action or 
                          using a MultiColvarFilter or ActionVolume action. When you do so 
                          the quantity is calculated for those atoms specified in the 
                          previous multicolvar. This is useful if you would like to calculate 
                          the Steinhardt parameter for those atoms that have a 
                          coordination number more than four for example 
               SPECIESA - this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination 
                          number. In that context it species that plumed should calculate one 
                          coordination number for each of the atoms specified in SPECIESA. Each of 
                          these cooordination numbers specifies how many of the atoms 
                          specifies using SPECIESB is within the specified cutoff. As with the 
                          species keyword the input can also be specified using the label of 
                          another multicolvar 
               SPECIESB - this keyword is used for colvars such as the coordination 
                          number. It must appear with SPECIESA. For a full explanation see 
                          the documentation for that keyword 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

      CRYSTAL_STRUCTURE - ( default=FCC ) Targeted crystal structure. Options are: 
                          SC: simple cubic, BCC: body center cubic, FCC: face centered 
                          cubic, HCP: hexagonal closed pack, DIAMOND: cubic diamond, CUSTOM: 
                          user defined 
      LATTICE_CONSTANTS - Lattice constants. Two comma separated values for HCP, one 
                          value for all other CRYSTAL_STRUCTURES. 
                  SIGMA - ( default=0.1 ) the width to use for the gaussian kernels 
                LCUTOFF - ( default=0.0001 ) any atoms separated by less than this 
                          tolerance should be ignored 
                 LAMBDA - ( default=100 ) Lambda parameter. This is only used if you 
                          have more than one reference environment 
                 CUTOFF - ( default=3 ) how many multiples of sigma would you like to 
                          consider beyond the maximum distance in the environment 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
              REFERENCE - PDB files with relative distances from central atom. Use 
                          this keyword if you are targeting a single reference 
                          environment. 
             REFERENCE_ - PDB files with relative distances from central atom. Each 
                          file corresponds to one template. Use these keywords if you are 
                          targeting more than one reference environment.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. REFERENCE_1, REFERENCE_2, 
                          REFERENCE_3... 
        ATOM_NAMES_FILE - PDB file with atom names for all atoms in SPECIES. Atoms in 
                          reference environments will be compared only if atom names match. 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

ERMSD.description: Calculate eRMSD with respect to a reference structure.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

CUTOFF.description: only pairs of atoms closer than CUTOFF are considered in the calculation

value.description: the eRMSD between the instantaneous structure and the reference structure that was input

ERMSD.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the list of atoms (use lcs). For more information on how to 
                          specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              REFERENCE - a file in pdb format containing the reference structure and 
                          the atoms involved in the CV. 
                 CUTOFF - ( default=2.4 ) only pairs of atoms closer than CUTOFF are 
                          considered in the calculation. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                  PAIRS - List of pairs considered. All pairs are considered if this 
                          value is not specified.
