altmin.description: the minimum value of the cv

between.description: the number of colvars that have a value that lies in a particular interval

HBPAMM_SA.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the atoms for which you would like to calculate the 
                          adjacency matrix. This is a depracated syntax that is equivalent to 
                          GROUP. You are strongly recommened to use GROUP instead of ATOMS. 
                 GROUPC - a group of atoms that must be summed over when calculating 
                          each element of the adjacency matrix. For more information on 
                          how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              NL_CUTOFF - ( default=0.0 ) The cutoff for the neighbor list. A value 
                          of 0 means we are not using a neighbor list 
              NL_STRIDE - ( default=1 ) The frequency with which we are updating the 
                          atoms in the neighbor list 
                  ORDER - ( default=dah ) the order in which the groups are specified 
                          in the input. Can be dah (donor/acceptor/hydrogens), adh 
                          (acceptor/donor/hydrogens) or hda (hydrogens/donor/acceptors 
               CLUSTERS - the name of the file that contains the definitions of all 
                          the kernels for PAMM 
             REGULARISE - ( default=0.001 ) don't allow the denominator to be smaller 
                          then this value 
           GAUSS_CUTOFF - ( default=6.25 ) the cutoff at which to stop evaluating the 
                          kernel function is set equal to sqrt(2*x)*(max(adc)+cov(adc)) 
              HYDROGENS - The list of hydrogen atoms that can form part of a hydrogen 
                          bond. The atoms must be specified using a comma separated list, 
                          an index range or by using a ef GROUP 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) don't use pbc 
                 USEGPU - ( default=off ) run this calculation on the GPU 
                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
                   MASK - a vector that is used to used to determine which rows of 
                          the adjancency matrix to compute 
                  SITES - The list of atoms which can be part of a hydrogen bond. 
                          When this command is used the set of atoms that can donate a 
                          hydrogen bond is assumed to be the same as the set of atoms that can 
                          form hydrogen bonds. The atoms involved must be specifiedas a 
                          list of labels of ef mcolv or labels of a ef 
                          multicolvarfunction actions. If you would just like to use the atomic positions 
                          you can use a ef DENSITY command to specify a group of atoms. 
                          Specifying your atomic positions using labels of other ef mcolv or 
                          ef multicolvarfunction commands is useful, however, as you can 
                          then exploit a much wider variety of functions of the contact 
                          matrix as described in ef contactmatrix 
                 DONORS - The list of atoms which can donate a hydrogen bond. The 
                          atoms involved must be specified as a list of labels of ef 
                          mcolv or labels of a ef multicolvarfunction actions. If you 
                          would just like to use the atomic positions you can use a ef 
                          DENSITY command to specify a group of atoms. Specifying your atomic 
                          positions using labels of other ef mcolv or ef 
                          multicolvarfunction commands is useful, however, as you can then exploit a much 
                          wider variety of functions of the contact matrix as described in 
                          ef contactmatrix 
              ACCEPTORS - The list of atoms which can accept a hydrogen bond. The 
                          atoms involved must be specified as a list of labels of ef 
                          mcolv or labels of a ef multicolvarfunction actions. If you 
                          would just like to use the atomic positions you can use a ef 
                          DENSITY command to specify a group of atoms. Specifying your atomic 
                          positions using labels of other ef mcolv or ef 
                          multicolvarfunction commands is useful, however, as you can then exploit a much 
                          wider variety of functions of the contact matrix as described in 
                          ef contactmatrix 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

SPECIES.description: the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated and the atoms that can be in the environments

SPECIESA.description: the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated

SPECIESB.description: the list of atoms that can be in the environments of each of the atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated

NN.description: The n parameter of the switching function

MM.description: The m parameter of the switching function; 0 implies 2*NN

D_0.description: The d_0 parameter of the switching function

R_0.description: The r_0 parameter of the switching function

SWITCH.description: the switching function that it used in the construction of the contact matrix

MASK.description: the label for a vector that is used to determine which rows of the matrix are computed

LESS_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are less than a certain target value

MORE_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are more than a certain target value

BETWEEN.description: calculate the number of values that are within a certain range

HIGHEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the highest of these variables

HISTOGRAM.description: calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of values

LOWEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the lowest of these variables

SUM.description: calculate the sum of all the quantities

MEAN.description: calculate the mean of all the quantities

PLANE.description: the plane to use when calculating the value of the order parameter should be xy, xz or yz

VMEAN.description: calculate the norm of the mean vector

VSUM.description: calculate the norm of the sum of all the vectors

morethan.description: the number of colvars that have a value more than a threshold

HEXACTIC_PARAMETER.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated and the atoms that can be in the environments 
               SPECIESA - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESB, 
                          which specifies the atoms that are in the environment. 
               SPECIESB - the list of atoms that can be in the environments of each 
                          of the atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESA, 
                          which specifies the atoms for which the symmetry function is 
                          being calculated. 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                     NN - ( default=6 ) The n parameter of the switching function 
                     MM - ( default=0 ) The m parameter of the switching function; 0 
                          implies 2*NN 
                    D_0 - ( default=0.0 ) The d_0 parameter of the switching function 
                    R_0 - The r_0 parameter of the switching function 
                  PLANE - the plane to use when calculating the value of the order 
                          parameter should be xy, xz or yz 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
                  VMEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the norm of the mean vector. 
                   VSUM - ( default=off ) calculate the norm of the sum of all the 
                          vectors 
                 SWITCH - the switching function that it used in the construction of 
                          the contact matrix 
                   MASK - the label for a vector that is used to determine which rows 
                          of the matrix are computed 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

HISTOGRAM.description: Accumulate the average probability density along a few CVs from a trajectory.

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

ARG.description: the quantities that are being used to construct the histogram

DATA.description: an alternative to the ARG keyword

GRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid

BANDWIDTH.description: the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation

KERNEL.description: the kernel function you are using

GRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with GRID_BIN)

value.description: the estimate of the histogram as a function of the argument that was obtained

HISTOGRAM.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

          NORMALIZATION - ( default=ndata ) This controls how the data is normalized 
                          it can be set equal to true, false or ndata. See above for an 
                          explanation 
               GRID_MIN - ( default=auto ) the lower bounds for the grid 
               GRID_MAX - ( default=auto ) the upper bounds for the grid 
                 KERNEL - ( default=GAUSSIAN ) the kernel function you are using. 
                          More details on the kernels available in plumed plumed can be 
                          found in ef kernelfunctions. 
                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which to store data for 
                          averaging 
                  CLEAR - ( default=0 ) the frequency with whihc to clear the data 
                          that is being averaged 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time 
                    ARG - the quantities that are being used to construct the 
                          histogram 
                   DATA - an alternative to the ARG keyword 
              BANDWIDTH - the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation 
               GRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
           GRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with GRID_BIN) 
             LOGWEIGHTS - the logarithm of the quantity to use as the weights when 
                          calculating averages

INCYLINDER.description: This quantity can be used to calculate functions of the distribution of collective variables for the atoms that lie in a particular, user-specified part of of the cell.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

USEGPU.description: run this calculation on the GPU

ATOMS.description: the group of atoms that you would like to investigate

OUTSIDE.description: calculate quantities for colvars that are on atoms outside the region of interest

CENTER.description: the atom whose vicinity we are interested in examining

SIGMA.description: the width of the function to be used for kernel density estimation

KERNEL.description: the type of kernel function to be used

DIRECTION.description: the direction of the long axis of the cylinder

RADIUS.description: a switching function that gives the extent of the cylinder in the plane perpendicular to the direction

LOWER.description: the lower boundary on the direction parallel to the long axis of the cylinder

UPPER.description: the upper boundary on the direction parallel to the long axis of the cylinder

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

DATA.description: the label of an action that calculates multicolvars

LESS_THAN.description: calcualte the number of colvars that are inside the region of interest and that are less than a certain threshold

MORE_THAN.description: calcualte the number of colvars that are inside the region of interest and that are greater that a certain threshold

BETWEEN.description: calculate the number of colvars that are inside the region of interest and that have a CV value that is between a particular set of bounds

SUM.description: calculate the sum of all the quantities

MEAN.description: calculate the average value of the colvar inside the region of interest

value.description: sum of values of input CVs in regin of interest

lessthan.description: the number of cvs in the region of interest that are less than a certain threshold

morethan.description: the number of cvs in the region of interest that are more than a certain threshold

between.description: the number of cvs in the region of interest that are within a certain range

sum.description: the sum of all the colvars weighted by the function that determines if we are in the region

mean.description: the average values of the colvar in the region of interest

INCYLINDER.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the group of atoms that you would like to investigate. For 
                          more information on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
                 CENTER - the atom whose vicinity we are interested in examining. For 
                          more information on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 KERNEL - ( default=gaussian ) the type of kernel function to be used 
              DIRECTION - the direction of the long axis of the cylinder. Must be x, 
                          y or z 
                 RADIUS - a switching function that gives the extent of the cylinder 
                          in the plane perpendicular to the direction 
                  LOWER - ( default=0.0 ) the lower boundary on the direction 
                          parallel to the long axis of the cylinder 
                  UPPER - ( default=0.0 ) the upper boundary on the direction 
                          parallel to the long axis of the cylinder 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
                 USEGPU - ( default=off ) run this calculation on the GPU 
                OUTSIDE - ( default=off ) calculate quantities for colvars that are 
                          on atoms outside the region of interest 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the average value of the colvar 
                          inside the region of interest 
                  SIGMA - the width of the function to be used for kernel density 
                          estimation 
                   DATA - the label of an action that calculates multicolvars. 
                          Weighted sums based on the location of the colvars calculated by 
                          this action will be calcualted 
              LESS_THAN - calcualte the number of colvars that are inside the region 
                          of interest and that are less than a certain threshold 
              MORE_THAN - calcualte the number of colvars that are inside the region 
                          of interest and that are greater that a certain threshold 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of colvars that are inside the region 
                          of interest and that have a CV value that is between a 
                          particular set of bounds

INENVELOPE.help:

MEAN.description: calculate the mean of all the quantities

INPLANEDISTANCES.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  GROUP - calculate distance for each distinct set of three atoms in 
                          the group. For more information on how to specify lists of 
                          atoms see ef Group 
            VECTORSTART - The first atom position that is used to define the normal 
                          to the plane of interest. For more information on how to 
                          specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
              VECTOREND - The second atom position that is used to defin the normal 
                          to the plane of interest. For more information on how to 
                          specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following options are available

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
                 USEGPU - ( default=off ) run this calculation on the GPU 
                OUTSIDE - ( default=off ) calculate quantities for colvars that are 
                          on atoms outside the region of interest

INTEGRATE_GRID.description: Calculate the numerical integral of the function stored on the grid

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the label of the function on a grid that is being integrated

PERIODIC.description: if the value of the output integral has a periodid domain then you use this keyword to specify the periodicity

value.description: the numerical integral of the input function over its whole domain

INTEGRATE_GRID.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label of the function on a grid that is being 
                          integrated 
               PERIODIC - if the value of the output integral has a periodid domain 
                          then you use this keyword to specify the periodicity. If the 
                          output integral is not periodic you must state this using 
                          PERIODIC=NO

INTERPOLATE_GRID.description: Interpolate a smooth function stored on a grid onto a grid with a smaller grid spacing.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

GRID_BIN.description: the number of bins for the grid

ARG.description: the label for function on the grid that you would like to interpolate

GRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with GRID_BIN)

MIDPOINTS.description: interpolate the values of the function at the midpoints of the grid coordinates of the input grid

INTERPOLATION_TYPE.description: the method to use for interpolation

ZERO_OUTSIDE_GRID_RANGE.description: if we are asked to evaluate the function for a number that is outside the range of the grid set it to zero

value.description: the function evaluated onto the interpolated grid

INTERPOLATE_GRID.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label for function on the grid that you would like to 
                          interpolate 
     INTERPOLATION_TYPE - ( default=spline ) the method to use for interpolation. Can 
                          be spline, linear, ceiling or floor. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
              MIDPOINTS - ( default=off ) interpolate the values of the function at 
                          the midpoints of the grid coordinates of the input grid 
ZERO_OUTSIDE_GRID_RANGE - ( default=off ) if we are asked to evaluate the function 
                          for a number that is outside the range of the grid set it to 
                          zero 
               GRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
           GRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with GRID_BIN)

INVERT_MATRIX.description: Calculate the inverse of the input matrix

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the input matrix

MATRIX.description: You should use ARG instead of this keyword which was used in older versions of PLUMED and is provided for back compatibility only

value.description: the inverse of the input matrix

INVERT_MATRIX.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the input matrix

JCOUPLING.description: Calculates 3J coupling constants for a dihedral angle.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the values from which the function is calculated

REWEIGHT.description: simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy

AVERAGING.description: Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean

LIKELIHOOD.description: the likelihood for the GENERIC metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN

DFTILDE.description: fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve ftilde

SCALEDATA.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling factor common to all values and replicas

SCALE0.description: initial value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MIN.description: minimum value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MAX.description: maximum value of the scaling factor

DSCALE.description: maximum MC move of the scaling factor

ADDOFFSET.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset common to all values and replicas

DOFFSET.description: maximum MC move of the offset

REGRES_ZERO.description: stride for regression with zero offset

SIGMA0.description: initial value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MIN.description: minimum value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MAX.description: maximum value of the uncertainty parameter

DSIGMA.description: maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter

OPTSIGMAMEAN.description: Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma mean, or to estimate it on the fly

SIGMA_MEAN0.description: starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate

SIGMA_MAX_STEPS.description: Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the SIGMA_MAX value is used

TEMP.description: the system temperature - this is only needed if code doesn't pass the temperature to plumed

STATUS_FILE.description: write a file with all the data useful for restart/continuation of Metainference

FMT.description: specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the number of digits in regtests)

WRITE_STRIDE.description: write the status to a file every N steps, this can be used for restart/continuation

NSELECT.description: range of values for selector [0, N-1]

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

ATOMS.description: the 4 atoms involved in each of the bonds for which you wish to calculate the J-coupling

TYPE.description: Type of J-coupling to compute (HAN,HAHN,CCG,NCG,CUSTOM)

COUPLING.description: Add an experimental value for each coupling

acceptFT.description: MC acceptance for general metainference f tilde value

biasDer.description: derivatives with respect to the bias

JCOUPLING.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  ATOMS - the 4 atoms involved in each of the bonds for which you 
                          wish to calculate the J-coupling. Keywords like ATOMS1, ATOMS2, 
                          ATOMS3,... should be listed and one J-coupling will be calculated for 
                          each ATOMS keyword you specify.. You can use multiple instances 
                          of this keyword i.e. ATOMS1, ATOMS2, ATOMS3... 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              NOISETYPE - ( default=MGAUSS ) functional form of the noise 
                          (GAUSS,MGAUSS,OUTLIERS,MOUTLIERS,GENERIC) 
             LIKELIHOOD - ( default=GAUSS ) the likelihood for the GENERIC 
                          metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN 
                DFTILDE - ( default=0.1 ) fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve 
                          ftilde 
                 SCALE0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the scaling factor 
            SCALE_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                OFFSET0 - ( default=0.0 ) initial value of the offset 
           OFFSET_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                 SIGMA0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MIN - ( default=0.0 ) minimum value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MAX - ( default=10. ) maximum value of the uncertainty parameter 
           OPTSIGMAMEAN - ( default=NONE ) Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma 
                          mean, or to estimate it on the fly 
           WRITE_STRIDE - ( default=10000 ) write the status to a file every N steps, 
                          this can be used for restart/continuation 
                   TYPE - Type of J-coupling to compute (HAN,HAHN,CCG,NCG,CUSTOM) 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                DOSCORE - ( default=off ) activate metainference 
             NOENSEMBLE - ( default=off ) don't perform any replica-averaging 
               REWEIGHT - ( default=off ) simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy 
              SCALEDATA - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling 
                          factor common to all values and replicas 
              ADDOFFSET - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset 
                          common to all values and replicas 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                    ARG - the labels of the values from which the function is 
                          calculated 
              AVERAGING - Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean 
              SCALE_MIN - minimum value of the scaling factor 
              SCALE_MAX - maximum value of the scaling factor 
                 DSCALE - maximum MC move of the scaling factor 
             OFFSET_MIN - minimum value of the offset 
             OFFSET_MAX - maximum value of the offset 
                DOFFSET - maximum MC move of the offset 
            REGRES_ZERO - stride for regression with zero offset 
                 DSIGMA - maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter 
            SIGMA_MEAN0 - starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate 
        SIGMA_MAX_STEPS - Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the 
                          SIGMA_MAX value is used 
                   TEMP - the system temperature - this is only needed if code 
                          doesn't pass the temperature to plumed 
               MC_STEPS - number of MC steps 
           MC_CHUNKSIZE - MC chunksize 
            STATUS_FILE - write a file with all the data useful for 
                          restart/continuation of Metainference 
                    FMT - specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the 
                          number of digits in regtests) 
               SELECTOR - name of selector 
                NSELECT - range of values for selector [0, N-1] 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
                      A - Karplus parameter A 
                      B - Karplus parameter B 
                      C - Karplus parameter C 
                  SHIFT - Angle shift in radians 
               COUPLING - Add an experimental value for each coupling. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. COUPLING1, COUPLING2, 
                          COUPLING3...

KDE.description: Create a histogram from the input scalar/vector/matrix using KDE

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the label for the value that should be used to construct the histogram

HEIGHTS.description: this keyword takes the label of an action that calculates a vector of values

VOLUMES.description: this keyword take the label of an action that calculates a vector of values

GRID_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the grid

GRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid

BANDWIDTH.description: the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation

METRIC.description: the inverse covariance to use for the kernels that are added to the grid

CUTOFF.description: the cutoff at which to stop evaluating the kernel functions is set equal to sqrt(2*x)*bandwidth in each direction where x is this number

KERNEL.description: the kernel function you are using

GRID_BIN.description: the number of bins for the grid

IGNORE_IF_OUT_OF_RANGE.description: if a kernel is outside of the range of the grid it is safe to ignore

GRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with GRID_BIN)

CONCENTRATION.description: the concentration parameter for Von Mises-Fisher distributions (only required for SPHERICAL_KDE)

MASKED_INPUT_ALLOWED.description: turns on that you are allowed to use masked inputs

value.description: a function on a grid that was obtained by doing a Kernel Density Estimation using the input arguments

KDE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label for the value that should be used to construct 
                          the histogram 
               GRID_MIN - ( default=auto ) the lower bounds for the grid 
               GRID_MAX - ( default=auto ) the upper bounds for the grid 
                 METRIC - the inverse covariance to use for the kernels that are 
                          added to the grid 
                 CUTOFF - ( default=6.25 ) the cutoff at which to stop evaluating the 
                          kernel functions is set equal to sqrt(2*x)*bandwidth in each 
                          direction where x is this number 
                 KERNEL - ( default=GAUSSIAN ) the kernel function you are using. 
                          More details on the kernels available in plumed plumed can be 
                          found in ef kernelfunctions. 
          CONCENTRATION - the concentration parameter for Von Mises-Fisher 
                          distributions (only required for SPHERICAL_KDE) 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) do the calculation in serial. Do not 
                          parallelize 
 IGNORE_IF_OUT_OF_RANGE - ( default=off ) if a kernel is outside of the range of the 
                          grid it is safe to ignore 
                HEIGHTS - this keyword takes the label of an action that calculates a 
                          vector of values. The elements of this vector are used as weights 
                          for the Gaussians. 
                VOLUMES - this keyword take the label of an action that calculates a 
                          vector of values. The elements of this vector divided by the 
                          volume of the Gaussian are used as weights for the Gaussians 
              BANDWIDTH - the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation 
               GRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
           GRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with GRID_BIN)

KERNEL.description: Transform a set of input coordinates using a kernel function

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the arguments that should be used as input to this method

TYPE.description: the type of kernel to use

CENTER.description: the position of the center of the kernel

SIGMA.description: square root of variance of the cluster

WEIGHT.description: the weight to multiply this kernel function by

REFERENCE.description: the file from which to read the kernel parameters

NUMBER.description: if there are multiple sets of kernel parameters in the input file which set of kernel parameters would you like to read in here

NORMALIZED.description: would you like the kernel function to be normalized

value.description: the value of the kernel evaluated at the argument values

KERNEL.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   TYPE - ( default=gaussian ) the type of kernel to use 
                 CENTER - the position of the center of the kernel 
                  COVAR - the covariance of the kernel 
                 WEIGHT - ( default=1.0 ) the weight to multiply this kernel function 
                          by 
                 NUMBER - ( default=1 ) if there are multiple sets of kernel 
                          parameters in the input file which set of kernel parameters would you 
                          like to read in here 

In addition you may use the following options: 

             NORMALIZED - ( default=off ) would you like the kernel function to be 
                          normalized 
                    ARG - the arguments that should be used as input to this method. 
                          You can use multiple instances of this keyword i.e. ARG1, ARG2, 
                          ARG3... 
                  SIGMA - square root of variance of the cluster 
              REFERENCE - the file from which to read the kernel parameters

KL_ENTROPY.description: Calculate the KL entropy of a distribution

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the grid that you wish to use in the KL entropy calculation

REFERENCE.description: a file containing the reference density in grid format

VALUE.description: the name of the value that should be read from the grid

value.description: the value of the KL-Entropy

KL_ENTROPY.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the grid that you wish to use in the KL entropy calculation 
              REFERENCE - a file containing the reference density in grid format 
                  VALUE - the name of the value that should be read from the grid

LANDMARK_SELECT_FPS.description: Select a of landmarks from a large set of configurations using farthest point sampling.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the COLLECT_FRAMES action that you used to get the data

DISSIMILARITIES.description: the matrix of dissimilarities if this is not provided the squared dissimilarities are calculated

NLANDMARKS.description: the numbe rof landmarks you would like to create

NOVORONOI.description: do not do a Voronoi analysis of the data to determine weights of final points

data.description: the data that is being collected by this action

logweights.description: the logarithms of the weights of the data points

rectdissims.description: a rectangular matrix containing the distances between the landmark points and the rest of the points

sqrdissims.description: a square matrix containing the distances between each pair of landmark points

LANDMARK_SELECT_FPS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

             NLANDMARKS - the numbe rof landmarks you would like to create 

In addition you may use the following options: 

              NOVORONOI - ( default=off ) do not do a Voronoi analysis of the data to 
                          determine weights of final points 
      NODISSIMILARITIES - ( default=off ) do not calculate the dissimilarities 
                    ARG - the COLLECT_FRAMES action that you used to get the data 
        DISSIMILARITIES - the matrix of dissimilarities if this is not provided the 
                          squared dissimilarities are calculated 
                   SEED - a random number seed

LESS_THAN.description: Use a switching function to determine how many of the input variables are less than a certain cutoff.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NN.description: The n parameter of the switching function

MM.description: The m parameter of the switching function; 0 implies 2*NN

D_0.description: The d_0 parameter of the switching function

R_0.description: The r_0 parameter of the switching function

SWITCH.description: This keyword is used if you want to employ an alternative to the continuous swiching function defined above

SQUARED.description: is the input quantity the square of the value that you would like to apply the switching function to

ARG.description: the values input to this function

MASK.description: the label for a sparse vector/matrix that should be used to determine which elements of the vector/matrix should be computed

value.description: a function that is one if the input is less than a threshold

LESS_THAN.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                     NN - ( default=6 ) The n parameter of the switching function 
                     MM - ( default=0 ) The m parameter of the switching function; 0 
                          implies 2*NN 
                    D_0 - ( default=0.0 ) The d_0 parameter of the switching function 
                    R_0 - The r_0 parameter of the switching function 
                    ARG - the values input to this function 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                SQUARED - ( default=off ) is the input quantity the square of the 
                          value that you would like to apply the switching function to 
                 SWITCH - This keyword is used if you want to employ an alternative 
                          to the continuous swiching function defined above. The 
                          following provides information on the ef switchingfunction that are 
                          available. When this keyword is present you no longer need the NN, MM, 
                          D_0 and R_0 keywords. 
                   MASK - the label for a sparse vector/matrix that should be used to 
                          determine which elements of the vector/matrix should be computed

FILE.description: file to be loaded

LOAD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   FILE - file to be loaded

LOCALENSEMBLE.description: Calculates the average over multiple arguments.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the actions that you want to use

.#!custom.description: the names of the output components for this action depend on the actions input file see the example inputs below for details

LOCALENSEMBLE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    NUM - the number of local replicas 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                    ARG - the labels of the actions that you want to use. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. ARG1, ARG2, ARG3...

LOCAL_AVERAGE.description: Calculate averages over spherical regions centered on atoms

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

SPECIES.description: the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated and the atoms that can be in the environments

SPECIESA.description: the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated

SPECIESB.description: the list of atoms that can be in the environments of each of the atoms for which the symmetry function is being calculated

NN.description: The n parameter of the switching function

MM.description: The m parameter of the switching function; 0 implies 2*NN

D_0.description: The d_0 parameter of the switching function

R_0.description: The r_0 parameter of the switching function

SWITCH.description: the switching function that it used in the construction of the contact matrix

MASK.description: the label for a vector that is used to determine which rows of the matrix are computed

LESS_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are less than a certain target value

MORE_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are more than a certain target value

BETWEEN.description: calculate the number of values that are within a certain range

HIGHEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the highest of these variables

HISTOGRAM.description: calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of values

LOWEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the lowest of these variables

SUM.description: calculate the sum of all the quantities

MEAN.description: calculate the mean of all the quantities

lessthan.description: the number of colvars that have a value less than a threshold

morethan.description: the number of colvars that have a value more than a threshold

altmin.description: the minimum value of the cv

between.description: the number of colvars that have a value that lies in a particular interval

value.description: the values of the local averages

LOCAL_AVERAGE.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated and the atoms that can be in the environments 
               SPECIESA - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESB, 
                          which specifies the atoms that are in the environment. 
               SPECIESB - the list of atoms that can be in the environments of each 
                          of the atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESA, 
                          which specifies the atoms for which the symmetry function is 
                          being calculated. 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                     NN - ( default=6 ) The n parameter of the switching function 
                     MM - ( default=0 ) The m parameter of the switching function; 0 
                          implies 2*NN 
                    D_0 - ( default=0.0 ) The d_0 parameter of the switching function 
                    R_0 - The r_0 parameter of the switching function 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
                 SWITCH - the switching function that it used in the construction of 
                          the contact matrix 
                   MASK - the label for a vector that is used to determine which rows 
                          of the matrix are computed 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

LOCAL_CRYSTALINITY.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated and the atoms that can be in the environments 
               SPECIESA - the list of atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESB, 
                          which specifies the atoms that are in the environment. 
               SPECIESB - the list of atoms that can be in the environments of each 
                          of the atoms for which the symmetry function is being 
                          calculated. This keyword must be used in conjunction with SPECIESA, 
                          which specifies the atoms for which the symmetry function is 
                          being calculated. 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                     NN - ( default=6 ) The n parameter of the switching function 
                     MM - ( default=0 ) The m parameter of the switching function; 0 
                          implies 2*NN 
                    D_0 - ( default=0.0 ) The d_0 parameter of the switching function 
                    R_0 - The r_0 parameter of the switching function 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
                 SWITCH - the switching function that it used in the construction of 
                          the contact matrix 
                   MASK - the label for a vector that is used to determine which rows 
                          of the matrix are computed 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like

                GVECTOR - the coefficients of the linear combinations to compute for

                          GVECTOR1, GVECTOR2, GVECTOR3...

LOCAL_Q1.description: Calculate the local degree of order around an atoms by taking the average dot product between the q_1 vector on the central atom and the q_3 vector on the atoms in the first coordination sphere.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

SPECIES.description: the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt parameters for which you would like to calculate local steinhardt parameters

SPECIESA.description: the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt parameters for which you would like to calculate local steinhardt parameters

SPECIESB.description: the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt parameters that you would like to use when calculating the loal steinhardt parameters

SWITCH.description: This keyword is used if you want to employ an alternative to the continuous swiching function defined above

MASK.description: the label/s for vectors that are used to determine which local steinhardt parameters to compute

LOWMEM.description: Including this keyword in the input to this action makes no difference to the calculation performed it was used in older versions of PLUMED and is provided here for back compatibility only

LESS_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are less than a certain target value

MORE_THAN.description: calculate the number of variables that are more than a certain target value

BETWEEN.description: calculate the number of values that are within a certain range

HIGHEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the highest of these variables

HISTOGRAM.description: calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of values

LOWEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the lowest of these variables

SUM.description: calculate the sum of all the quantities

MEAN.description: calculate the mean of all the quantities

value.description: the values of the local steinhardt parameters for the input atoms

lessthan.description: the number of colvars that have a value less than a threshold

morethan.description: the number of colvars that have a value more than a threshold

altmin.description: the minimum value of the cv

between.description: the number of colvars that have a value that lies in a particular interval

LOCAL_Q1.help:
The following options are available

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables. 
                 LOWEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the lowest 
                          of these variables. 
                    SUM - ( default=off ) calculate the sum of all the quantities. 
                   MEAN - ( default=off ) calculate the mean of all the quantities. 
                SPECIES - the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt 
                          parameters for which you would like to calculate local steinhardt 
                          parameters 
               SPECIESA - the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt 
                          parameters for which you would like to calculate local steinhardt 
                          parameters 
               SPECIESB - the label of the action that computes the Steinhardt 
                          parameters that you would like to use when calculating the loal 
                          steinhardt parameters 
                 SWITCH - This keyword is used if you want to employ an alternative 
                          to the continuous swiching function defined above. The 
                          following provides information on the ef switchingfunction that are 
                          available. When this keyword is present you no longer need the NN, MM, 
                          D_0 and R_0 keywords. 
                   MASK - the label/s for vectors that are used to determine which 
                          local steinhardt parameters to compute 
              LESS_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are less than a 
                          certain target value. 
              MORE_THAN - calculate the number of variables that are more than a 
                          certain target value. 
                ALT_MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MIN - calculate the minimum value. 
                    MAX - calculate the maximum value. 
                BETWEEN - calculate the number of values that are within a certain 
                          range. These quantities are calculated using kernel density 
                          estimation as described on ef histogrambead.. You can use multiple 
                          instances of this keyword i.e. BETWEEN1, BETWEEN2, BETWEEN3... 
              HISTOGRAM - calculate a discretized histogram of the distribution of 
                          values. This shortcut allows you to calculates NBIN quantites like 
                          BETWEEN.

LOGMFD.description: Used to perform LogMFD, LogPD, and TAMD/d-AFED.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

INTERVAL.description: Period of MD steps (N_m) to update fictitious dynamical variables

DELTA_T.description: Time step for the fictitious dynamical variables (DELTA_T=1 often works)

THERMOSTAT.description: Type of thermostat for the fictitious dynamical variables

TEMP.description: Target temperature for the fictitious dynamical variables in LogMFD/PD

TAMD.description: When TAMD=1, TAMD/d-AFED calculations can be performed instead of LogMFD

KAPPA.description: Spring constant of the harmonic restraining potential

FICT_MAX.description: Maximum values reachable for the fictitious dynamical variables

FICT_MIN.description: Minimum values reachable for the fictitious dynamical variables

FICT.description: The initial values of the fictitious dynamical variables

VFICT.description: The initial velocities of the fictitious dynamical variables

MFICT.description: Masses of each fictitious dynamical variable

XETA.description: The initial eta variable of the Nose-Hoover thermostat for the fictitious dynamical variables

VETA.description: The initial velocity of eta variable

FLOG.description: The initial free energy value in the LogMFD/PD run

WORK.description: The initial value of the work done by fictitious dynamical variables in each replica

TEMPPD.description: Temperature of the Boltzmann factor in the Jarzynski weight in LogPD (Gromacs only)

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

_fict.description: For example, the fictitious collective variable for LogMFD is specified as ARG=dist12 and LABEL=logmfd in LOGMFD section in Plumed input file, the associated fictitious dynamical variable can be specified as PRINT ARG=dist12,logmfd

_vfict.description: For example, the fictitious collective variable for LogMFD is specified as ARG=dist12 and LABEL=logmfd in LOGMFD section in Plumed input file, the velocity of the associated fictitious dynamical variable can be specified as PRINT ARG=dist12,logmfd

LOGMFD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
               INTERVAL - Period of MD steps (N_m) to update fictitious dynamical 
                          variables. 
                DELTA_T - Time step for the fictitious dynamical variables (DELTA_T=1 
                          often works). 
             THERMOSTAT - Type of thermostat for the fictitious dynamical variables. 
                          NVE, NVT, VS are available. 
                  KAPPA - Spring constant of the harmonic restraining potential. 
               FICT_MAX - Maximum values reachable for the fictitious dynamical 
                          variables. The variables will elastically bounce back at the boundary 
                          (mirror boundary). 
               FICT_MIN - Minimum values reachable for the fictitious dynamical 
                          variables. The variables will elastically bounce back at the boundary 
                          (mirror boundary). 
                   FLOG - The initial free energy value in the LogMFD/PD run.The 
                          origin of the free energy profile is adjusted by FLOG to realize 
                          F(X(t)) > 0 at any X(t), resulting in enhanced barrier-crossing. 
                          (The value of H_log is automatically set according to FLOG). In 
                          fact, F(X(t)) is correctly estimated in PLUMED even when F(X(t)) 
                          < 0 in the LogMFD/PD run. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                   TEMP - Target temperature for the fictitious dynamical variables 
                          in LogMFD/PD. It is recommended to set TEMP to be the same as 
                          the temperature of the MD system in any thermostated LogMFD/PD 
                          run. If not provided, it will be taken from the temperature of 
                          the MD system (Gromacs only). 
                   TAMD - When TAMD=1, TAMD/d-AFED calculations can be performed 
                          instead of LogMFD. Otherwise, the LogMFD protocol is switched on 
                          (default). 
                  ALPHA - Alpha parameter for LogMFD. If not provided or provided as 
                          0, it will be taken as 1/gamma. If gamma is also not provided, 
                          Alpha is set as 4, which is a sensible value when the unit of 
                          kcal/mol is used. 
                  GAMMA - Gamma parameter for LogMFD. If not provided or provided as 
                          0, it will be taken as 1/alpha. If alpha is also not provided, 
                          Gamma is set as 0.25, which is a sensible value when the unit of 
                          kcal/mol is used. 
                   FICT - The initial values of the fictitious dynamical variables. 
                          If not provided, they are set equal to their corresponding CVs 
                          for the initial atomic configuration. 
                  VFICT - The initial velocities of the fictitious dynamical 
                          variables. If not provided, they will be taken as 0. If THERMOSTAT=VS, 
                          they are instead automatically adjusted according to TEMP. 
                  MFICT - Masses of each fictitious dynamical variable. If not 
                          provided, they will be taken as 10000. 
                   XETA - The initial eta variable of the Nose-Hoover thermostat for 
                          the fictitious dynamical variables. If not provided, it will be 
                          taken as 0. 
                   VETA - The initial velocity of eta variable. If not provided, it 
                          will be taken as 0. 
                   META - Mass of eta variable. If not provided, it will be taken as 
                          N*kb*T*100*100. 
                   WORK - The initial value of the work done by fictitious dynamical 
                          variables in each replica. If not provided, it will be taken as 0. 
                 TEMPPD - Temperature of the Boltzmann factor in the Jarzynski weight 
                          in LogPD (Gromacs only). TEMPPD should be the same as the 
                          temperature of the MD system, while TEMP may be (in principle) 
                          different from it. If not provided, TEMPPD is set to be the same 
                          value as TEMP.

MAXENT.description: Add a linear biasing potential on one or more variables that satisfies a maximum entropy principle.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

KAPPA.description: specifies the initial value for the learning rate

TAU.description: Specify the dumping time for the learning rate

TYPE.description: specify the restraint type

ERROR_TYPE.description: specify the prior on the error to use

TSTART.description: time from where to start averaging the Lagrangian multiplier

TEND.description: time in ps where to stop to compute the average of Lagrangian multiplier

ALPHA.default: 1.0; To be used with LAPLACE KEYWORD, allows to choose a prior function proportional to a Gaussian times an exponential function. ALPHA=1 correspond to the LAPLACE prior.

SIGMA.description: The typical errors expected on observable

FILE.description: Lagrangian multipliers output file

LEARN_REPLICA.description: In a multiple replica environment specify which is the reference replica

APPLY_WEIGHTS.description: Vector of weights containing 1 in correspondence of each replica that will receive the Lagrangian multiplier from the current one

PACE.description: the frequency for Lagrangian multipliers update

PRINT_STRIDE.description: stride of Lagrangian multipliers output file

FMT.description: specify format for Lagrangian multipliers files (useful to decrease the number of digits in regtests)

REWEIGHT.description: to be used with plumed driver in order to reweight a trajectory a posteriori

NO_BROADCAST.description: If active will avoid Lagrangian multipliers to be communicated to other replicas

TEMP.description: the system temperature

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

force2.description: the instantaneous value of the squared force due to this bias potential

work.description: the instantaneous value of the work done by the biasing force

_work.description: the instantaneous value of the work done by the biasing force for each argument

_error.description: Instantaneous values of the discrepancy between the observable and the restraint center

MAXENT.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                  KAPPA - ( default=0.0 ) specifies the initial value for the 
                          learning rate 
                    TAU - Specify the dumping time for the learning rate. 
                   TYPE - specify the restraint type. EQUAL to restrain the variable 
                          at a given equilibrium value INEQUAL< to restrain the variable 
                          to be smaller than a given value INEQUAL> to restrain the 
                          variable to be greater than a given value 
                     AT - the position of the restraint 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
               REWEIGHT - ( default=off ) to be used with plumed driver in order to 
                          reweight a trajectory a posteriori 
           NO_BROADCAST - ( default=off ) If active will avoid Lagrangian multipliers 
                          to be communicated to other replicas. 
             ERROR_TYPE - specify the prior on the error to use.GAUSSIAN: use a 
                          Gaussian prior LAPLACE: use a Laplace prior 
                 TSTART - time from where to start averaging the Lagrangian 
                          multiplier. By default no average is computed, hence lambda is updated 
                          every PACE steps 
                   TEND - time in ps where to stop to compute the average of 
                          Lagrangian multiplier. From this time until the end of the simulation 
                          Lagrangian multipliers are kept fix to the average computed between 
                          TSTART and TEND; 
                  ALPHA - default=1.0; To be used with LAPLACE KEYWORD, allows to 
                          choose a prior function proportional to a Gaussian times an 
                          exponential function. ALPHA=1 correspond to the LAPLACE prior. 
                  SIGMA - The typical errors expected on observable 
                   FILE - Lagrangian multipliers output file. The default name is: 
                          label name followed by the string .LAGMULT 
          LEARN_REPLICA - In a multiple replica environment specify which is the 
                          reference replica. By default replica 0 will be used. 
          APPLY_WEIGHTS - Vector of weights containing 1 in correspondence of each 
                          replica that will receive the Lagrangian multiplier from the 
                          current one. 
                   PACE - the frequency for Lagrangian multipliers update 
           PRINT_STRIDE - stride of Lagrangian multipliers output file. If no STRIDE 
                          is passed they are written every time they are updated (PACE). 
                    FMT - specify format for Lagrangian multipliers files (useful to 
                          decrease the number of digits in regtests) 
                   TEMP - the system temperature. This is required if you are 
                          reweighting. 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO)

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

value.description: the value of the loss function

MAZE_LOSS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 PARAMS - Parameters for the loss function. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances

MAZE_MEMETIC_SAMPLING.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                 LIGAND - Indices of ligand atoms.. For more information on how to 
                          specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
                PROTEIN - Indices of protein atoms.. For more information on how to 
                          specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 N_ITER - Number of optimization steps. Required only for optimizers, 
                          do not pass this keyword to the fake optimizers (results in 
                          crash) , e.g., random walk, steered MD, or random acceleration MD. 
       OPTIMIZER_STRIDE - Optimizer stride. Sets up a callback function that launches 
                          the optimization process every OPTIMIZER_STRIDE. 
               CAPACITY - Sampling set size. 
          MUTATION_RATE - Probability of mutation. 
            MATING_RATE - Probability of mating. 
           CAUCHY_ALPHA - Mean of Cauchy distribution for sampling. 
            CAUCHY_BETA - Spread of Cauchy distribution for sampling. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) Perform the simulation in serial -- used 
                          only for debugging purposes, should not be used otherwise. 
                   PAIR - ( default=off ) Pair only the 1st element of the 1st group 
                          with the 1st element in the second, etc. 
                  NLIST - ( default=off ) Use a neighbor list of ligand-protein atom 
                          pairs to speed up the calculating of the distances. 
        LOCAL_SEARCH_ON - ( default=off ) Turn local search on. 
              NL_CUTOFF - Neighbor list cut-off for the distances of ligand-protein 
                          atom pairs. 
              NL_STRIDE - Update stride for the ligand-protein atom pairs in the 
                          neighbor list. 
                   LOSS - Loss function describing ligand-protein interactions 
                          required by every optimizer. 
           N_LOCAL_ITER - Number of local search iterations. 
      LOCAL_SEARCH_RATE - Rate of mutation in local search. 
      LOCAL_SEARCH_TYPE - Type of local search.

MAZE_OPTIMIZER_BIAS.description: Biases the ligand along the direction calculated by the chosen MAZE_OPTIMIZER.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

OPTIMIZER.description: Optimization technique to minimize the collective variable for ligand     unbinding: RANDOM_WALK,                STEERED_MD,                RANDOM_ACCELERATION_MD,                SIMULATED_ANNEALING,                MEMETIC_SAMPLING

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

x.description: Optimal biasing direction: x component

y.description: Optimal biasing direction: y component

z.description: Optimal biasing direction: z component

tdist.description: Total distance traveled by biased atoms

MAZE_OPTIMIZER_BIAS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
           BIASING_RATE - Biasing rate. 
                  ALPHA - Rescaled force constant. 
              OPTIMIZER - Optimization technique to minimize the collective variable 
                          for ligand unbinding: RANDOM_WALK, STEERED_MD, 
                          RANDOM_ACCELERATION_MD, SIMULATED_ANNEALING, MEMETIC_SAMPLING 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically
