MEAN.description: Calculate the arithmetic mean of the elements in a vector

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the vector/matrix/grid whose elements shuld be added together

PERIODIC.description: if the output of your function is periodic then you should specify the periodicity of the function

MASKED_INPUT_ALLOWED.description: turns on that you are allowed to use masked inputs

value.description: the MEAN of the elements in the input value

MEAN.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the vector/matrix/grid whose elements shuld be added 
                          together 
               PERIODIC - if the output of your function is periodic then you should 
                          specify the periodicity of the function. If the output is not 
                          periodic you must state this using PERIODIC=NO

MEMFUSIONP.description: Calculate a CV that can induce the formation of the hemifusion stalk between two initially flat and planar bilayers.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

UMEMBRANE.description: all the beads of the upper membrane

LMEMBRANE.description: all the beads of the lower membrane

TAILS.description: all the tail beads of the system

NSMEM.description: the number of slices of the membrane fusion cylinder in such a way that when the bilayers are flat and parallel the CV is equal to 0

DSMEM.description: thickness of the slices of the membrane fusion cylinder

HMEM.description: parameter of the step function (x,h) for the membrane fusion

RCYLMEM.description: the radius of the membrane fusion cylinder

ONEOVERS2C2CUTOFF.description: cut off large values for the derivative of the atan2 function

XCYL.description: X coordinate of the fixed cylinder, if not present this will be calculated

YCYL.description: Y coordinate of the fixed cylinder, if not present this will be calculated

value.description: the value of the CV

MEMFUSIONP.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

              UMEMBRANE - all the beads of the upper membrane. For more information 
                          on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
              LMEMBRANE - all the beads of the lower membrane. For more information 
                          on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 
                  TAILS - all the tail beads of the system. For more information on 
                          how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                  NSMEM - the number of slices of the membrane fusion cylinder in 
                          such a way that when the bilayers are flat and parallel the CV 
                          is equal to 0.2. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                  DSMEM - ( default=0.1) thickness of the slices of the membrane 
                          fusion cylinder. 
                   HMEM - ( default=0.25 ) parameter of the step function (x,h) for 
                          the membrane fusion. 
                RCYLMEM - ( default=1.75 ) the radius of the membrane fusion 
                          cylinder. 
                ZETAMEM - ( default=0.5 ) occupation factor. 
      ONEOVERS2C2CUTOFF - ( default=500 ) cut off large values for the derivative of 
                          the atan2 function. 
                   XCYL - X coordinate of the fixed cylinder, if not present this 
                          will be calculated. 
                   YCYL - Y coordinate of the fixed cylinder, if not present this 
                          will be calculated.

METAD.description: Used to performed metadynamics on one or more collective variables.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

SIGMA.description: the widths of the Gaussian hills

FILE.description: a file in which the list of added hills is stored

HEIGHT.description: the heights of the Gaussian hills

FMT.description: specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the number of digits in regtests)

BIASFACTOR.description: use well tempered metadynamics and use this bias factor

CALC_WORK.description: calculate the total accumulated work done by the bias since last restart

RECT.description: list of bias factors for all the replicas

TTBIASFACTOR.description: use transition tempered metadynamics with this bias factor

TTBIASTHRESHOLD.description: use transition tempered metadynamics with this bias threshold

TTALPHA.description: use transition tempered metadynamics with this hill size decay exponent parameter

TEMP.description: the system temperature - this is only needed if you are doing well-tempered metadynamics

TAU.description: in well tempered metadynamics, sets height to (k_B Delta T*pace*timestep)/tau

CALC_RCT.description: calculate the c(t) reweighting factor and use that to obtain the normalized bias [rbias=bias-rct]

RCT_USTRIDE.description: the update stride for calculating the c(t) reweighting factor

GRID_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the grid

GRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid

GRID_BIN.description: the number of bins for the grid

GRID_SPACING.description: the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative or together with GRID_BIN)

GRID_SPARSE.description: use a sparse grid to store hills

GRID_NOSPLINE.description: don't use spline interpolation with grids

GRID_WSTRIDE.description: write the grid to a file every N steps

GRID_WFILE.description: the file on which to write the grid

GRID_RFILE.description: a grid file from which the bias should be read at the initial step of the simulation

STORE_GRIDS.description: store all the grid files the calculation generates

NLIST.description: Use neighbor list for kernels summation, faster but experimental

NLIST_PARAMETERS.description: the two cutoff parameters for the Gaussians neighbor list

ADAPTIVE.description: use a geometric (=GEOM) or diffusion (=DIFF) based hills width scheme

SIGMA_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the sigmas (in CV units) when using adaptive hills

SIGMA_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the sigmas (in CV units) when using adaptive hills

WALKERS_DIR.description: shared directory with the hills files from all the walkers

WALKERS_MPI.description: Switch on MPI version of multiple walkers - not compatible with WALKERS_* options other than WALKERS_DIR

INTERVAL.description: one dimensional lower and upper limits, outside the limits the system will not feel the biasing force

FLYING_GAUSSIAN.description: Switch on flying Gaussian method, must be used with WALKERS_MPI

ACCELERATION.description: Set to TRUE if you want to compute the metadynamics acceleration factor

ACCELERATION_RFILE.description: a data file from which the acceleration should be read at the initial step of the simulation

CALC_MAX_BIAS.description: Set to TRUE if you want to compute the maximum of the metadynamics V(s, t)

CALC_TRANSITION_BIAS.description: Set to TRUE if you want to compute a metadynamics transition bias V*(t)

TRANSITIONWELL.description: This keyword appears multiple times as TRANSITIONWELL followed by an integer

FREQUENCY_ADAPTIVE.description: Set to TRUE if you want to enable frequency adaptive metadynamics such that the frequency for hill addition to change dynamically based on the acceleration factor

FA_UPDATE_FREQUENCY.description: the frequency for updating the hill addition pace in frequency adaptive metadynamics, by default this is equal to the value given in PACE

FA_MAX_PACE.description: the maximum hill addition frequency allowed in frequency adaptive metadynamics

FA_MIN_ACCELERATION.description: only update the hill addition pace in frequency adaptive metadynamics after reaching the minimum acceleration factor given here

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

rbias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias normalized using the c(t) reweighting factor [rbias=bias-rct]

maxbias.description: the maximum of the metadynamics V(s, t)

pace.description: the hill addition frequency when employing frequency adaptive metadynamics

nlker.description: number of hills in the neighbor list

nlsteps.description: number of steps from last neighbor list update

METAD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                  SIGMA - the widths of the Gaussian hills 
                   PACE - the frequency for hill addition 
                   FILE - ( default=HILLS ) a file in which the list of added hills 
                          is stored 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
              CALC_WORK - ( default=off ) calculate the total accumulated work done 
                          by the bias since last restart 
               CALC_RCT - ( default=off ) calculate the c(t) reweighting factor and 
                          use that to obtain the normalized bias [rbias=bias-rct].This 
                          method is not compatible with metadynamics not on a grid. 
            GRID_SPARSE - ( default=off ) use a sparse grid to store hills 
          GRID_NOSPLINE - ( default=off ) don't use spline interpolation with grids 
            STORE_GRIDS - ( default=off ) store all the grid files the calculation 
                          generates. They will be deleted if this keyword is not present 
                  NLIST - ( default=off ) Use neighbor list for kernels summation, 
                          faster but experimental 
            WALKERS_MPI - ( default=off ) Switch on MPI version of multiple walkers - 
                          not compatible with WALKERS_* options other than WALKERS_DIR 
        FLYING_GAUSSIAN - ( default=off ) Switch on flying Gaussian method, must be 
                          used with WALKERS_MPI 
           ACCELERATION - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to compute the 
                          metadynamics acceleration factor. 
          CALC_MAX_BIAS - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to compute the 
                          maximum of the metadynamics V(s, t) 
   CALC_TRANSITION_BIAS - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to compute a 
                          metadynamics transition bias V*(t) 
     FREQUENCY_ADAPTIVE - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to enable frequency 
                          adaptive metadynamics such that the frequency for hill addition to 
                          change dynamically based on the acceleration factor. 
                 HEIGHT - the heights of the Gaussian hills. Compulsory unless TAU 
                          and either BIASFACTOR or DAMPFACTOR are given 
                    FMT - specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the 
                          number of digits in regtests) 
             BIASFACTOR - use well tempered metadynamics and use this bias factor. 
                          Please note you must also specify temp 
                   RECT - list of bias factors for all the replicas 
             DAMPFACTOR - damp hills with exp(-max(V)/(kT*DAMPFACTOR) 
           TTBIASFACTOR - use transition tempered metadynamics with this bias factor. 
                          Please note you must also specify temp 
        TTBIASTHRESHOLD - use transition tempered metadynamics with this bias 
                          threshold. Please note you must also specify TTBIASFACTOR 
                TTALPHA - use transition tempered metadynamics with this hill size 
                          decay exponent parameter. Please note you must also specify 
                          TTBIASFACTOR 
                 TARGET - target to a predefined distribution 
                   TEMP - the system temperature - this is only needed if you are 
                          doing well-tempered metadynamics 
                    TAU - in well tempered metadynamics, sets height to (k_B Delta 
                          T*pace*timestep)/tau 
            RCT_USTRIDE - the update stride for calculating the c(t) reweighting 
                          factor.The default 1, so c(t) is updated every time the bias is 
                          updated. 
               GRID_MIN - the lower bounds for the grid 
               GRID_MAX - the upper bounds for the grid 
               GRID_BIN - the number of bins for the grid 
           GRID_SPACING - the approximate grid spacing (to be used as an alternative 
                          or together with GRID_BIN) 
           GRID_WSTRIDE - write the grid to a file every N steps 
             GRID_WFILE - the file on which to write the grid 
             GRID_RFILE - a grid file from which the bias should be read at the 
                          initial step of the simulation 
       NLIST_PARAMETERS - (default=6.,0.5) the two cutoff parameters for the 
                          Gaussians neighbor list 
               ADAPTIVE - use a geometric (=GEOM) or diffusion (=DIFF) based hills 
                          width scheme. Sigma is one number that has distance units or time 
                          step dimensions 
              SIGMA_MAX - the upper bounds for the sigmas (in CV units) when using 
                          adaptive hills. Negative number means no bounds 
              SIGMA_MIN - the lower bounds for the sigmas (in CV units) when using 
                          adaptive hills. Negative number means no bounds 
             WALKERS_ID - walker id 
              WALKERS_N - number of walkers 
            WALKERS_DIR - shared directory with the hills files from all the walkers 
        WALKERS_RSTRIDE - stride for reading hills files 
               INTERVAL - one dimensional lower and upper limits, outside the limits 
                          the system will not feel the biasing force. 
     ACCELERATION_RFILE - a data file from which the acceleration should be read at 
                          the initial step of the simulation 
         TRANSITIONWELL - This keyword appears multiple times as TRANSITIONWELL 
                          followed by an integer. Each specifies the coordinates for one well 
                          as in transition-tempered metadynamics. At least one must be 
                          provided.. You can use multiple instances of this keyword i.e. 
                          TRANSITIONWELL1, TRANSITIONWELL2, TRANSITIONWELL3... 
    FA_UPDATE_FREQUENCY - the frequency for updating the hill addition pace in 
                          frequency adaptive metadynamics, by default this is equal to the 
                          value given in PACE 
            FA_MAX_PACE - the maximum hill addition frequency allowed in frequency 
                          adaptive metadynamics. By default there is no maximum value. 
    FA_MIN_ACCELERATION - only update the hill addition pace in frequency adaptive 
                          metadynamics after reaching the minimum acceleration factor given here. 
                          By default it is 1.0. 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

METAINFERENCE.description: Calculates the Metainference energy for a set of experimental data.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

PARARG.description: reference values for the experimental data, these can be provided as arguments without derivatives

PARAMETERS.description: reference values for the experimental data

REWEIGHT.description: simple REWEIGHT using the latest ARG as energy

AVERAGING.description: Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean

LIKELIHOOD.description: the likelihood for the GENERIC metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN

DFTILDE.description: fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve ftilde

SCALEDATA.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling factor common to all values and replicas

SCALE0.description: initial value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MIN.description: minimum value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MAX.description: maximum value of the scaling factor

DSCALE.description: maximum MC move of the scaling factor

ADDOFFSET.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset common to all values and replicas

DOFFSET.description: maximum MC move of the offset

REGRES_ZERO.description: stride for regression with zero offset

SIGMA0.description: initial value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MIN.description: minimum value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MAX.description: maximum value of the uncertainty parameter

DSIGMA.description: maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter

OPTSIGMAMEAN.description: Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma mean, or to estimate it on the fly

SIGMA_MEAN0.description: starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate

SIGMA_MAX_STEPS.description: Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the SIGMA_MAX value is used

TEMP.description: the system temperature - this is only needed if code doesn't pass the temperature to plumed

STATUS_FILE.description: write a file with all the data useful for restart/continuation of Metainference

FMT.description: specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the number of digits in regtests)

WRITE_STRIDE.description: write the status to a file every N steps, this can be used for restart/continuation

NSELECT.description: range of values for selector [0, N-1]

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

acceptFT.description: MC acceptance for general metainference f tilde value

biasDer.description: derivatives with respect to the bias

METAINFERENCE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
              NOISETYPE - ( default=MGAUSS ) functional form of the noise 
                          (GAUSS,MGAUSS,OUTLIERS,MOUTLIERS,GENERIC) 
             LIKELIHOOD - ( default=GAUSS ) the likelihood for the GENERIC 
                          metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN 
                DFTILDE - ( default=0.1 ) fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve 
                          ftilde 
                 SCALE0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the scaling factor 
            SCALE_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                OFFSET0 - ( default=0.0 ) initial value of the offset 
           OFFSET_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                 SIGMA0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MIN - ( default=0.0 ) minimum value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MAX - ( default=10. ) maximum value of the uncertainty parameter 
           OPTSIGMAMEAN - ( default=NONE ) Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma 
                          mean, or to estimate it on the fly 
           WRITE_STRIDE - ( default=10000 ) write the status to a file every N steps, 
                          this can be used for restart/continuation 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
             NOENSEMBLE - ( default=off ) don't perform any replica-averaging 
               REWEIGHT - ( default=off ) simple REWEIGHT using the latest ARG as 
                          energy 
              SCALEDATA - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling 
                          factor common to all values and replicas 
              ADDOFFSET - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset 
                          common to all values and replicas 
                 PARARG - reference values for the experimental data, these can be 
                          provided as arguments without derivatives 
             PARAMETERS - reference values for the experimental data 
              AVERAGING - Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean 
              SCALE_MIN - minimum value of the scaling factor 
              SCALE_MAX - maximum value of the scaling factor 
                 DSCALE - maximum MC move of the scaling factor 
             OFFSET_MIN - minimum value of the offset 
             OFFSET_MAX - maximum value of the offset 
                DOFFSET - maximum MC move of the offset 
            REGRES_ZERO - stride for regression with zero offset 
                 DSIGMA - maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter 
            SIGMA_MEAN0 - starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate 
        SIGMA_MAX_STEPS - Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the 
                          SIGMA_MAX value is used 
                   TEMP - the system temperature - this is only needed if code 
                          doesn't pass the temperature to plumed 
               MC_STEPS - number of MC steps 
           MC_CHUNKSIZE - MC chunksize 
            STATUS_FILE - write a file with all the data useful for 
                          restart/continuation of Metainference 
                    FMT - specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the 
                          number of digits in regtests) 
               SELECTOR - name of selector 
                NSELECT - range of values for selector [0, N-1] 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO)

METATOMIC.description: Use arbitrary machine learning models as collective variables.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

MODEL.description: path to the exported metatomic model

EXTENSIONS_DIRECTORY.description: path to the directory containing TorchScript extensions to load

DEVICE.description: Torch device to use for the calculations

CHECK_CONSISTENCY.description: should we enable internal consistency checks when executing the model

SPECIES.description: the indices of atoms in each PLUMED species

SELECTED_ATOMS.description: subset of atoms that should be used for the calculation

SPECIES_TO_TYPES.description: mapping from PLUMED SPECIES to metatomic's atom types

outputs.description: collective variable created by the metatomic model

value.description: collective variable created by the metatomic model

METATOMIC.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                SPECIES - the indices of atoms in each PLUMED species. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. SPECIES1, SPECIES2, 
                          SPECIES3... 
         SELECTED_ATOMS - subset of atoms that should be used for the calculation 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

                  MODEL - path to the exported metatomic model 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
      CHECK_CONSISTENCY - ( default=off ) should we enable internal consistency 
                          checks when executing the model 
   EXTENSIONS_DIRECTORY - path to the directory containing TorchScript extensions to 
                          load 
                 DEVICE - Torch device to use for the calculations 
       SPECIES_TO_TYPES - mapping from PLUMED SPECIES to metatomic's atom types

MFILTER_LESS.description: Apply a switching function to the input vector.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

DATA.description: the vector you wish to transform

SWITCH.description: the switching function that transform

value.description: a vector that has the same dimension as the input vector with elements equal to one if the corresponding component of the vector is less than a tolerance and zero otherwise

MFILTER_LESS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   DATA - the vector you wish to transform 
                 SWITCH - the switching function that transform

MFILTER_MORE.description: Apply one minus a switching function to the input vector.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

DATA.description: the vector you wish to transform

SWITCH.description: the switching function that transform

LOWMEM.description: Including this keyword in the input to this action makes no difference to the calculation performed it was used in older versions of PLUMED and is provided here for back compatibility only

HIGHEST.description: this flag allows you to recover the highest of these variables

MFILTER_MORE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   DATA - the vector you wish to transform 
                 SWITCH - the switching function that transform 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                HIGHEST - ( default=off ) this flag allows you to recover the highest 
                          of these variables.

MOLINFO.description: This command is used to provide information on the molecules that are present in your system.

STRUCTURE.description: a file in pdb format containing a reference structure

MOLTYPE.description: what kind of molecule is contained in the pdb file - usually not needed since protein/RNA/DNA are compatible

CHAIN.description: (for masochists ( mostly Davide Branduardi ) ) The atoms involved in each of the chains of interest in the structure

STRIDE.description: frequency for resetting the python interpreter

WHOLE.description: The reference structure is whole, i

MOLINFO.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                  CHAIN - (for masochists ( mostly Davide Branduardi ) ) The atoms 
                          involved in each of the chains of interest in the structure.. For 
                          more information on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              STRUCTURE - a file in pdb format containing a reference structure. This 
                          is used to defines the atoms in the various residues, chains, 
                          etc . For more details on the PDB file format visit 
                          http://www.wwpdb.org/docs.html 
                MOLTYPE - ( default=protein ) what kind of molecule is contained in 
                          the pdb file - usually not needed since protein/RNA/DNA are 
                          compatible 
             PYTHON_BIN - ( default=default ) python interpreter 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                  WHOLE - ( default=off ) The reference structure is whole, i.e. not 
                          broken by PBC

MOVINGRESTRAINT.description: Add a time-dependent, harmonic restraint on one or more variables.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

VERSE.description: Tells plumed whether the restraint is only acting for CV larger (U) or smaller (L) than the restraint or whether it is acting on both sides (B)

STEP.description: This keyword appears multiple times as STEPx with x=0,1,2,

AT.description: ATx is equal to the position of the restraint at time STEPx

KAPPA.description: KAPPAx is equal to the value of the force constants at time STEPx

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

work.description: the total work performed changing this restraint

force2.description: the instantaneous value of the squared force due to this bias potential

_cntr.description: one or multiple instances of this quantity can be referenced elsewhere in the input file

_work.description: one or multiple instances of this quantity can be referenced elsewhere in the input file

_kappa.description: one or multiple instances of this quantity can be referenced elsewhere in the input file

MOVINGRESTRAINT.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                  VERSE - ( default=B ) Tells plumed whether the restraint is only 
                          acting for CV larger (U) or smaller (L) than the restraint or 
                          whether it is acting on both sides (B) 
                   STEP - This keyword appears multiple times as STEPx with 
                          x=0,1,2,...,n. Each value given represents the MD step at which the 
                          restraint parameters take the values KAPPAx and ATx.. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. STEP1, STEP2, STEP3... 
                     AT - ATx is equal to the position of the restraint at time 
                          STEPx. For intermediate times this parameter is linearly 
                          interpolated. If no ATx is specified for STEPx then the values of AT are 
                          kept constant during the interval of time between STEP(x-1) and 
                          STEPx.. You can use multiple instances of this keyword i.e. AT1, 
                          AT2, AT3... 
                  KAPPA - KAPPAx is equal to the value of the force constants at time 
                          STEPx. For intermediate times this parameter is linearly 
                          interpolated. If no KAPPAx is specified for STEPx then the values of 
                          KAPPAx are kept constant during the interval of time between 
                          STEP(x-1) and STEPx.. You can use multiple instances of this keyword 
                          i.e. KAPPA1, KAPPA2, KAPPA3... 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically

MULTICOLVARDENS.description: Evaluate the average value of a multicolvar on a grid.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which to accumulate the densities

CLEAR.description: the frequency with which to clear the density

ORIGIN.description: we will use the position of this atom as the origin

DIR.description: the direction in which to calculate the density profile

BANDWIDTH.description: the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation

KERNEL.description: the kernel function you are using

NBINS.description: the number of bins to use in each direction (alternative to GRID_NBIN)

GRID_MIN.description: the lower bounds for the grid (default boxlengths)

GRID_MAX.description: the upper bounds for the grid (default boxlengths)

DATA.description: the multicolvar which you would like to calculate the density profile for

ATOMS.description: if you are calculating a atomic density you use this keyword to specify the atoms that are involved

UNORMALIZED.description: do not divide by the density

NORMALIZATION.description: set true/false to determine how to the data is normalised

value.description: the average value of the order parameters at each point on the grid

MULTICOLVARDENS.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                 STRIDE - ( default=1 ) the frequency with which to accumulate the 
                          densities 
                  CLEAR - ( default=0 ) the frequency with which to clear the density 
                 ORIGIN - we will use the position of this atom as the origin 
                    DIR - the direction in which to calculate the density profile 
                 KERNEL - ( default=GAUSSIAN ) the kernel function you are using. 
                          More details on the kernels available in plumed plumed can be 
                          found in ef kernelfunctions. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

            UNORMALIZED - ( default=off ) do not divide by the density 
              BANDWIDTH - the bandwidths for kernel density esimtation 
                  NBINS - the number of bins to use in each direction (alternative to 
                          GRID_NBIN) 
               GRID_MIN - the lower bounds for the grid (default boxlengths) 
               GRID_MAX - the upper bounds for the grid (default boxlengths) 
                   DATA - the multicolvar which you would like to calculate the 
                          density profile for 
                  ATOMS - if you are calculating a atomic density you use this 
                          keyword to specify the atoms that are involved 
          NORMALIZATION - set true/false to determine how to the data is normalised

MULTI_RMSD.description: Calculate RMSD distances for different domains and combine them.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

REFERENCE.description: a file in pdb format containing the reference structure and the atoms involved in the CV

TYPE.description: the manner in which RMSD alignment is performed

SQUARED.description: This should be set if you want the mean squared displacement instead of the root mean squared displacement

NOPBC.description: don't use periodic boundary conditions

value.description: the sum of the multiple RMSD distances

MULTI_RMSD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

              REFERENCE - a file in pdb format containing the reference structure and 
                          the atoms involved in the CV. 
                   TYPE - ( default=SIMPLE ) the manner in which RMSD alignment is 
                          performed. Should be MULTI-OPTIMAL, MULTI-OPTIMAL-FAST, MULTI-SIMPLE 
                          or MULTI-DRMSD. 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                SQUARED - ( default=off ) This should be set if you want the mean 
                          squared displacement instead of the root mean squared displacement 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) don't use periodic boundary conditions

NEIGHBORS.description: Build a matrix with ones in for the N nearest neighbours of an atom

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the label of an adjacency/distance matrix that will be used to find the nearest neighbors

NLOWEST.description: in each row of the output matrix set the elements that correspond to the n lowest elements in each row of the input matrix equal to one

NHIGHEST.description: in each row of the output matrix set the elements that correspond to the n highest elements in each row of the input matrix equal to one

value.description: a matrix in which the ij element is one if the ij-element of the input matrix is one of the NLOWEST/NHIGHEST elements on that row of the input matrix and zero otherwise

NEIGHBORS.help:

                          to find the nearest neighbors 
                NLOWEST - ( default=0 ) in each row of the output matrix set the 
                          elements that correspond to the n lowest elements in each row of the 
                          input matrix equal to one 
               NHIGHEST - ( default=0 ) in each row of the output matrix set the 
                          elements that correspond to the n highest elements in each row of 
                          the input matrix equal to one

NEMATIC_ORDER.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

        MOLECULE_STARTS - The atoms where the molecular axis starts.. For more 
                          information on how to specify lists of atoms see ef Group

NOE.description: Calculates NOE intensities as sums of 1/r^6, also averaging over multiple equivalent atoms

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the values from which the function is calculated

REWEIGHT.description: simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy

AVERAGING.description: Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean

LIKELIHOOD.description: the likelihood for the GENERIC metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN

DFTILDE.description: fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve ftilde

SCALEDATA.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling factor common to all values and replicas

SCALE0.description: initial value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MIN.description: minimum value of the scaling factor

SCALE_MAX.description: maximum value of the scaling factor

DSCALE.description: maximum MC move of the scaling factor

ADDOFFSET.description: Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset common to all values and replicas

DOFFSET.description: maximum MC move of the offset

REGRES_ZERO.description: stride for regression with zero offset

SIGMA0.description: initial value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MIN.description: minimum value of the uncertainty parameter

SIGMA_MAX.description: maximum value of the uncertainty parameter

DSIGMA.description: maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter

OPTSIGMAMEAN.description: Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma mean, or to estimate it on the fly

SIGMA_MEAN0.description: starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate

SIGMA_MAX_STEPS.description: Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the SIGMA_MAX value is used

TEMP.description: the system temperature - this is only needed if code doesn't pass the temperature to plumed

STATUS_FILE.description: write a file with all the data useful for restart/continuation of Metainference

FMT.description: specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the number of digits in regtests)

WRITE_STRIDE.description: write the status to a file every N steps, this can be used for restart/continuation

NSELECT.description: range of values for selector [0, N-1]

NOPBC.description: ignore the periodic boundary conditions when calculating distances

GROUPA.description: the atoms involved in each of the contacts you wish to calculate

GROUPB.description: the atoms involved in each of the contacts you wish to calculate

NOEDIST.description: Add an experimental value for each NOE

acceptFT.description: MC acceptance for general metainference f tilde value

biasDer.description: derivatives with respect to the bias

NOE.help:
The input trajectory can be in any of the following formats: 

                 GROUPA - the atoms involved in each of the contacts you wish to 
                          calculate. Keywords like GROUPA1, GROUPA2, GROUPA3,... should be 
                          listed and one contact will be calculated for each ATOM keyword 
                          you specify.. You can use multiple instances of this keyword 
                          i.e. GROUPA1, GROUPA2, GROUPA3... 
                 GROUPB - the atoms involved in each of the contacts you wish to 
                          calculate. Keywords like GROUPB1, GROUPB2, GROUPB3,... should be 
                          listed and one contact will be calculated for each ATOM keyword 
                          you specify.. You can use multiple instances of this keyword 
                          i.e. GROUPB1, GROUPB2, GROUPB3... 

The following arguments are compulsory: 

              NOISETYPE - ( default=MGAUSS ) functional form of the noise 
                          (GAUSS,MGAUSS,OUTLIERS,MOUTLIERS,GENERIC) 
             LIKELIHOOD - ( default=GAUSS ) the likelihood for the GENERIC 
                          metainference model, GAUSS or LOGN 
                DFTILDE - ( default=0.1 ) fraction of sigma_mean used to evolve 
                          ftilde 
                 SCALE0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the scaling factor 
            SCALE_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                OFFSET0 - ( default=0.0 ) initial value of the offset 
           OFFSET_PRIOR - ( default=FLAT ) either FLAT or GAUSSIAN 
                 SIGMA0 - ( default=1.0 ) initial value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MIN - ( default=0.0 ) minimum value of the uncertainty parameter 
              SIGMA_MAX - ( default=10. ) maximum value of the uncertainty parameter 
           OPTSIGMAMEAN - ( default=NONE ) Set to NONE/SEM to manually set sigma 
                          mean, or to estimate it on the fly 
           WRITE_STRIDE - ( default=10000 ) write the status to a file every N steps, 
                          this can be used for restart/continuation 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                DOSCORE - ( default=off ) activate metainference 
             NOENSEMBLE - ( default=off ) don't perform any replica-averaging 
               REWEIGHT - ( default=off ) simple REWEIGHT using the ARG as energy 
              SCALEDATA - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample a scaling 
                          factor common to all values and replicas 
              ADDOFFSET - ( default=off ) Set to TRUE if you want to sample an offset 
                          common to all values and replicas 
                  NOPBC - ( default=off ) ignore the periodic boundary conditions 
                          when calculating distances 
                    ARG - the labels of the values from which the function is 
                          calculated 
              AVERAGING - Stride for calculation of averaged weights and sigma_mean 
              SCALE_MIN - minimum value of the scaling factor 
              SCALE_MAX - maximum value of the scaling factor 
                 DSCALE - maximum MC move of the scaling factor 
             OFFSET_MIN - minimum value of the offset 
             OFFSET_MAX - maximum value of the offset 
                DOFFSET - maximum MC move of the offset 
            REGRES_ZERO - stride for regression with zero offset 
                 DSIGMA - maximum MC move of the uncertainty parameter 
            SIGMA_MEAN0 - starting value for the uncertainty in the mean estimate 
        SIGMA_MAX_STEPS - Number of steps used to optimise SIGMA_MAX, before that the 
                          SIGMA_MAX value is used 
                   TEMP - the system temperature - this is only needed if code 
                          doesn't pass the temperature to plumed 
               MC_STEPS - number of MC steps 
           MC_CHUNKSIZE - MC chunksize 
            STATUS_FILE - write a file with all the data useful for 
                          restart/continuation of Metainference 
                    FMT - specify format for HILLS files (useful for decrease the 
                          number of digits in regtests) 
               SELECTOR - name of selector 
                NSELECT - range of values for selector [0, N-1] 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
                NOEDIST - Add an experimental value for each NOE.. You can use 
                          multiple instances of this keyword i.e. NOEDIST1, NOEDIST2, 
                          NOEDIST3...

NORMALIZED_EUCLIDEAN_DISTANCE.description: Calculate the normalised euclidean distance between two points in CV space

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG1.description: The poin that we are calculating the distance from

ARG2.description: The point that we are calculating the distance to

METRIC.description: The inverse covariance matrix that should be used when calculating the distance

SQUARED.description: The squared distance should be calculated

value.description: the normalized euclidean distances between the input vectors

NORMALIZED_EUCLIDEAN_DISTANCE.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   ARG1 - The poin that we are calculating the distance from 
                   ARG2 - The point that we are calculating the distance to 
                 METRIC - The inverse covariance matrix that should be used when 
                          calculating the distance 

In addition you may use the following options: 

                SQUARED - ( default=off ) The squared distance should be calculated

ONES.description: Create a constant vector with all elements equal to one

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

IS_SHORTCUT.description: hidden keyword to tell if actions are shortcuts so that example generator can provide expansions of shortcuts

SIZE.description: the number of ones that you would like to create

value.description: a vector of ones with the required number of elements

ONES.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   SIZE - the number of ones that you would like to create

OPES_EXPANDED.description: On-the-fly probability enhanced sampling with expanded ensembles for the target distribution.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

ARG.description: the label of the ECVs that define the expansion

PACE.description: how often the bias is updated

OBSERVATION_STEPS.description: number of unbiased initial PACE steps to collect statistics for initialization

FILE.description: a file with the estimate of the relative Delta F for each component of the target and of the global c(t)

PRINT_STRIDE.description: stride for printing to DELTAFS file, in units of PACE

FMT.description: specify format for DELTAFS file

STATE_RFILE.description: read from this file the Delta F estimates and all the info needed to RESTART the simulation

STATE_WFILE.description: write to this file the Delta F estimates and all the info needed to RESTART the simulation

STATE_WSTRIDE.description: number of MD steps between writing the STATE_WFILE

STORE_STATES.description: append to STATE_WFILE instead of ovewriting it each time

CALC_WORK.description: calculate the total accumulated work done by the bias since last restart

WALKERS_MPI.description: switch on MPI version of multiple walkers

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

work.description: total accumulated work done by the bias

OPES_EXPANDED.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the label of the ECVs that define the expansion. You can 
                          use an * to make sure all the output components of the ECVs are 
                          used, as in the examples above 
                   PACE - how often the bias is updated 
      OBSERVATION_STEPS - ( default=100 ) number of unbiased initial PACE steps to 
                          collect statistics for initialization 
                   FILE - ( default=DELTAFS ) a file with the estimate of the 
                          relative Delta F for each component of the target and of the global 
                          c(t) 
           PRINT_STRIDE - ( default=100 ) stride for printing to DELTAFS file, in 
                          units of PACE 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
           STORE_STATES - ( default=off ) append to STATE_WFILE instead of ovewriting 
                          it each time 
              CALC_WORK - ( default=off ) calculate the total accumulated work done 
                          by the bias since last restart 
            WALKERS_MPI - ( default=off ) switch on MPI version of multiple walkers 
                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) perform calculations in serial 
                    FMT - specify format for DELTAFS file 
            STATE_RFILE - read from this file the Delta F estimates and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
            STATE_WFILE - write to this file the Delta F estimates and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
          STATE_WSTRIDE - number of MD steps between writing the STATE_WFILE. Default 
                          is only on CPT events (but not all MD codes set them) 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

OPES_METAD.description: On-the-fly probability enhanced sampling with metadynamics-like target distribution.

LABEL.description: a label for the action so that its output can be referenced in the input to other actions

NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES.description: calculate the derivatives for these quantities numerically

HAS_VALUES.description: this is used in json output to determine those actions that have values

ARG.description: the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act

STRIDE.description: the frequency with which the forces due to the bias should be calculated

TEMP.description: temperature

SIGMA.description: the initial widths of the kernels

BARRIER.description: the free energy barrier to be overcome

COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD.description: merge kernels if closer than this threshold, in units of sigma

ADAPTIVE_SIGMA_STRIDE.description: number of steps for measuring adaptive sigma

SIGMA_MIN.description: never reduce SIGMA below this value

BIASFACTOR.description: the gamma bias factor used for the well-tempered target distribution

EPSILON.description: the value of the regularization constant for the probability

KERNEL_CUTOFF.description: truncate kernels at this distance, in units of sigma

NLIST_PARAMETERS.description: the two cutoff parameters for the kernels neighbor list

NLIST.description: use neighbor list for kernels summation, faster but experimental

NLIST_PACE_RESET.description: force the reset of the neighbor list at each PACE

FIXED_SIGMA.description: do not decrease sigma as the simulation proceeds

RECURSIVE_MERGE_OFF.description: do not recursively attempt kernel merging when a new one is added

NO_ZED.description: do not normalize over the explored CV space, Z_n=1

FILE.description: a file in which the list of all deposited kernels is stored

FMT.description: specify format for KERNELS file

STATE_RFILE.description: read from this file the compressed kernels and all the info needed to RESTART the simulation

STATE_WFILE.description: write to this file the compressed kernels and all the info needed to RESTART the simulation

STATE_WSTRIDE.description: number of MD steps between writing the STATE_WFILE

STORE_STATES.description: append to STATE_WFILE instead of ovewriting it each time

EXCLUDED_REGION.description: kernels are not deposited when the action provided here has a nonzero value, see example above

EXTRA_BIAS.description: consider also these other bias potentials for the internal reweighting

CALC_WORK.description: calculate the total accumulated work done by the bias since last restart

WALKERS_MPI.description: switch on MPI version of multiple walkers

UPDATE_FROM.description: Only update this action from this time

UPDATE_UNTIL.description: Only update this action until this time

bias.description: the instantaneous value of the bias potential

nker.description: total number of compressed kernels used to represent the bias

work.description: total accumulated work done by the bias

nlker.description: number of kernels in the neighbor list

nlsteps.description: number of steps from last neighbor list update

OPES_METAD.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the scalars on which the bias will act 
                   TEMP - ( default=-1 ) temperature. If not set, it is taken from MD 
                          engine, but not all MD codes provide it 
                   PACE - the frequency for kernel deposition 
                  SIGMA - ( default=ADAPTIVE ) the initial widths of the kernels. If 
                          not set, an adaptive sigma will be used with the given 
                          ADAPTIVE_SIGMA_STRIDE 
                BARRIER - the free energy barrier to be overcome. It is used to set 
                          BIASFACTOR, EPSILON, and KERNEL_CUTOFF to reasonable values 
  COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD - ( default=1 ) merge kernels if closer than this threshold, 
                          in units of sigma 
                   FILE - ( default=KERNELS ) a file in which the list of all 
                          deposited kernels is stored 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NLIST - ( default=off ) use neighbor list for kernels summation, 
                          faster but experimental 
       NLIST_PACE_RESET - ( default=off ) force the reset of the neighbor list at 
                          each PACE. Can be useful with WALKERS_MPI 
            FIXED_SIGMA - ( default=off ) do not decrease sigma as the simulation 
                          proceeds. Can be added in a RESTART, to keep in check the number of 
                          compressed kernels 
    RECURSIVE_MERGE_OFF - ( default=off ) do not recursively attempt kernel merging 
                          when a new one is added 
                 NO_ZED - ( default=off ) do not normalize over the explored CV 
                          space, Z_n=1 
           STORE_STATES - ( default=off ) append to STATE_WFILE instead of ovewriting 
                          it each time 
              CALC_WORK - ( default=off ) calculate the total accumulated work done 
                          by the bias since last restart 
            WALKERS_MPI - ( default=off ) switch on MPI version of multiple walkers 
                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) perform calculations in serial 
  ADAPTIVE_SIGMA_STRIDE - number of steps for measuring adaptive sigma. Default is 
                          10xPACE 
              SIGMA_MIN - never reduce SIGMA below this value 
             BIASFACTOR - the gamma bias factor used for the well-tempered target 
                          distribution. Set to 'inf' for uniform flat target 
                EPSILON - the value of the regularization constant for the 
                          probability 
          KERNEL_CUTOFF - truncate kernels at this distance, in units of sigma 
       NLIST_PARAMETERS - ( default=3.0,0.5 ) the two cutoff parameters for the 
                          kernels neighbor list 
                    FMT - specify format for KERNELS file 
            STATE_RFILE - read from this file the compressed kernels and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
            STATE_WFILE - write to this file the compressed kernels and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
          STATE_WSTRIDE - number of MD steps between writing the STATE_WFILE. Default 
                          is only on CPT events (but not all MD codes set them) 
        EXCLUDED_REGION - kernels are not deposited when the action provided here has 
                          a nonzero value, see example above 
             EXTRA_BIAS - consider also these other bias potentials for the internal 
                          reweighting. This can be used e.g. for sampling a custom target 
                          distribution (see example above) 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

                          deposited kernels is stored 

In addition you may use the following options: 

  NUMERICAL_DERIVATIVES - ( default=off ) calculate the derivatives for these 
                          quantities numerically 
                  NLIST - ( default=off ) use neighbor list for kernels summation, 
                          faster but experimental 
       NLIST_PACE_RESET - ( default=off ) force the reset of the neighbor list at 
                          each PACE. Can be useful with WALKERS_MPI 
            FIXED_SIGMA - ( default=off ) do not decrease sigma as the simulation 
                          proceeds. Can be added in a RESTART, to keep in check the number of 
                          compressed kernels 
    RECURSIVE_MERGE_OFF - ( default=off ) do not recursively attempt kernel merging 
                          when a new one is added 
                 NO_ZED - ( default=off ) do not normalize over the explored CV 
                          space, Z_n=1 
           STORE_STATES - ( default=off ) append to STATE_WFILE instead of ovewriting 
                          it each time 
              CALC_WORK - ( default=off ) calculate the total accumulated work done 
                          by the bias since last restart 
            WALKERS_MPI - ( default=off ) switch on MPI version of multiple walkers 
                 SERIAL - ( default=off ) perform calculations in serial 
  ADAPTIVE_SIGMA_STRIDE - number of steps for measuring adaptive sigma. Default is 
                          10xPACE 
              SIGMA_MIN - never reduce SIGMA below this value 
             BIASFACTOR - the gamma bias factor used for the well-tempered target 
                          distribution. Cannot be 'inf' 
                EPSILON - the value of the regularization constant for the 
                          probability 
          KERNEL_CUTOFF - truncate kernels at this distance, in units of sigma 
       NLIST_PARAMETERS - ( default=3.0,0.5 ) the two cutoff parameters for the 
                          kernels neighbor list 
                    FMT - specify format for KERNELS file 
            STATE_RFILE - read from this file the compressed kernels and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
            STATE_WFILE - write to this file the compressed kernels and all the info 
                          needed to RESTART the simulation 
          STATE_WSTRIDE - number of MD steps between writing the STATE_WFILE. Default 
                          is only on CPT events (but not all MD codes set them) 
        EXCLUDED_REGION - kernels are not deposited when the action provided here has 
                          a nonzero value, see example above 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time

OPT_ADAM.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                   BIAS - the label of the VES bias to be optimized 
                 STRIDE - the frequency of updating the coefficients given in the 
                          number of MD steps. 
            COEFFS_FILE - ( default=coeffs.data ) the name of output file for the 
                          coefficients 
          COEFFS_OUTPUT - ( default=100 ) how often the coefficients should be 
                          written to file. This parameter is given as the number of 
                          iterations. 
               STEPSIZE - the step size used for the optimization 

In addition you may use the following options: 

MONITOR_INSTANTANEOUS_GRADIENT - ( default=off ) if quantities related to the instantaneous 
                          gradient should be outputted. 
       MULTIPLE_WALKERS - ( default=off ) if optimization is to be performed using 
                          multiple walkers connected via MPI 
                AMSGRAD - ( default=off ) Use the AMSGrad variant 
             COEFFS_FMT - specify format for coefficient file(s) (useful for decrease 
                          the number of digits in regtests) 
   COEFFS_SET_ID_PREFIX - suffix to add to the filename given in FILE to identify the 
                          bias, should only be given if a single filename is given in FILE 
                          when optimizing multiple biases. 
         INITIAL_COEFFS - the name(s) of file(s) with the initial coefficients 
TARGETDIST_AVERAGES_FILE - the name of output file for the target distribution 
                          averages. By default it is targetdist-averages.data. 
TARGETDIST_AVERAGES_OUTPUT - how often the target distribution averages should be 
                          written out to file. Note that the value is given in terms of 
                          coefficient iterations. If no value is given are the averages only 
                          written at the beginning of the optimization 
            BIAS_OUTPUT - how often the bias(es) should be written out to file. Note 
                          that the value is given in terms of coefficient iterations. 
             FES_OUTPUT - how often the FES(s) should be written out to file. Note 
                          that the value is given in terms of coefficient iterations. 
        FES_PROJ_OUTPUT - how often the projections of the FES(s) should be written 
                          out to file. Note that the value is given in terms of 
                          coefficient iterations. 
                RESTART - allows per-action setting of restart (YES/NO/AUTO) 
            UPDATE_FROM - Only update this action from this time 
           UPDATE_UNTIL - Only update this action until this time 
              MASK_FILE - read in a mask file which allows one to employ different 
                          step sizes for different coefficients and/or deactivate the 
                          optimization of certain coefficients (by putting values of 0.0). One can 
                          write out the resulting mask by using the OUTPUT_MASK_FILE 
                          keyword. 
       OUTPUT_MASK_FILE - Name of the file to write out the mask resulting from using 
                          the MASK_FILE keyword. Can also be used to generate a template 
                          mask file. 
      TARGETDIST_STRIDE - stride for updating a target distribution that is 
                          iteratively updated during the optimization. Note that the value is 
                          given in terms of coefficient iterations. 
      TARGETDIST_OUTPUT - how often the dynamic target distribution(s) should be 
                          written out to file. Note that the value is given in terms of 
                          coefficient iterations. 
 TARGETDIST_PROJ_OUTPUT - how often the projections of the dynamic target 
                          distribution(s) should be written out to file. Note that the value is given 
                          in terms of coefficient iterations. 
                 BETA_1 - Parameter for the first moment estimate. Defaults to 0.9 
                 BETA_2 - Parameter for the second moment estimate. Defaults to 0.999 
                EPSILON - Small parameter to avoid division by zero. Defaults to 1e-8 
     ADAMW_WEIGHT_DECAY - Weight decay parameter for the AdamW variant. Defaults to 0

ARG.description: the labels of the two vectors from which the outer product is being computed

value.description: a matrix containing the outer product of the two input vectors that was obtained using the function that was input

OUTER_PRODUCT.help:
The following arguments are compulsory: 

                    ARG - the labels of the two vectors from which the outer product 
                          is being computed 
                   FUNC - ( default=x*y ) the function of the input vectors that 
                          should be put in the elements of the outer product 

In addition you may use the following options: 

ELEMENTS_ON_DIAGONAL_ARE_ZERO - ( default=off ) set all diagonal elements to zero 
                   MASK - a matrix that is used to used to determine which elements 
                          of the output matrix to compute
